Maria Coralia is a member and founder of the Mujeres en Prosperidad Trust Bank. She is 56 years old, married and has nine children, five of which still depend on her. Coralia, as she is known locally, is named in honor of a person who provided work to her father for several years. In the photo, Coralia is the third woman (from left to right), she is wearing a black blouse with purple flowers. 

Coralia has operated a food vendor business for the past 13 years. She sells small portions of typical Guatemalan food and operates her business from Monday to Saturday. She wakes up at 4:00 a.m. to prepare everything, and then she goes to the market from 8:00 a.m. to 1:00 p.m. to sell her products. Her business has slowly grown over the years, and she has been able to help pay for her children's education. While most of her children only completed the sixth grade before they stopped going to school, Coralia is optimistic that at least her younger children will reach high school. 

Coralia is excited to receive a new loan, which she will use to start a new business. She is a very innovative woman and recently traveled to another city (three hours from home) for training in baking and decorations. She now wants to use her newfound knowledge to start a bakery. The loan that she receives will be used for two purposes: to invest in the existing business (food), and to buy some materials, such as a mixer, for baking. 

"Access to loans for women is a great opportunity for growth; it makes us more independent and allows us to make our own decisions," said Coralia. "My dream for my current business as for my new business is that in the future the two of them can be sustainable, so I further support my children's education." 

The Mujeres en Prosperidad Trust Bank is very surprised that people from other countries have the desire to invest in them and are thankful that Kiva lenders reach out and trust them to use the loans wisely.

loans.use: To invest in the existing business (food), and to buy some materials, a mixer, for baking.

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr:
Cliente de 37 anas, mariée et mère de 4 enfants dont tous sont scolarises, a l'obtention de son bac n'ayant pas de moyen pour continuer des etudes universitaires, elle se lance dans la vente de la friperie et des ustensiles en plastique.
Ayant beneficiee deja de 3 cycles de prêts,ses ventes ont énormément évolue, elle a remboursée avec succès et a fait des épargnes considérables et avec ses benefices elle vient d'ouvrir une boutique de chaussures en plein marche.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elle va renforcer le stock des ballots de friperie comme les baskets , des sandales pour homme et enfants, acheter de la peinture pour repeindre et  améliorer ses conditions de vente.
 Elle tient a aller jusqu'au bout en ce qui concerne son commerce et elle a pour ambition de devenir une grande femme d'affaire.
texts.en:
This borrower is 37 years old, married, and the mother of four children who all attend school.  After getting her high school degree, she lacked the financial means to go to college, and became involved in the sale of used shoes and plastic utensils.
She has already benefited from three loan cycles, which has had a very positive impact on her sales.  She has successfully repaid her loans and has saved a lot of money.  With her profits, she has just opened a shoe store at the very center of the market.
With this new loan, she will increase her stock of second-hand shoes and buy sneakers and sandals for men and children.  She will also buy some paint to improve the appearance of her store and therefore her working environment.
She is very motivated when it comes to her retail business and her ambition is to become an important business woman.

loans.use: to buy bags of shoes for women and sneakers for men and children.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia has been in the dressmaking business in Nakuru town for the last two years. She is 29 years old and single. She plans to use this loan amount to buy clothing material for use in her business. 

In the future , Julia hopes expand her business and open more dressmaking shops in Nakuru.

loans.use: buy dressmaking materials

loans.name: Gaudensia

texts.en:
Gaudensia is a 38-year-old married woman. She has 4 children with ages ranging from 4 years to 13 years. She describes herself to be social and honest. 

Gaudenia operates a food stall where she sells doughnuts. She has been involved in this business for 1 year. Her business is located at a shopping centre. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. 

Gaudenia will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy food ingredients.  Her  business goal is to expand her food stall within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her living standard.

loans.use: buy food ingredients

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
This is Tessie, 54, a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Romeo, 57, a self-employed man.  Tessie is a mother of two children, both are high school students. While attending to her family, she also keeps herself busy with her business as her way of helping her husband in sustaining their daily expenses. 

Tessie owns a variety store. She buys groceries like canned goods, condiments, milk, sugar, primary commodities that are needed in every household. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 800 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Tessie is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more grocery items to enable her to have more stocks. The more items are displayed at the store the better, as they help to attract more customers to buy in her variety store. More sales will result in better profit, which will help her to save more money for the expenses of her children in school. 

Tessie hopes that her business will maintain an income that is sufficient for the needs of her family. She dreams that all her children will be able to finish their studies and be able to land a good and stable job someday. She wants to make available additional appliances that they need. She is active in attending the weekly fellowship* as it helps to learn a lot from the Bible. It strengthens her spiritual life.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 36 years old.  She is married to Mbogo.  Together they have three children.  

Jane sells fruits and has been in the business for the past two years.  This is her first term loan in KADET LTD.  She was brought to KADET LTD by a staff member.  She will use this loan amount to purchase more stock of fruits for resale in her business.  She hopes to own a supermarket in the near future.

loans.use: buy fruits

loans.name: Adrien

texts.en:
Adrien has one child who is two years old.   He is married to a farmer.   He has been a rice farmer since 2004.  He would like to get this Kiva loan to buy fertilizers, seeds, and pay support labor to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been farming to get more output as well as make more savings from the profits.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: buy more fertilizer, seeds and pay labor costs

loans.name: Mariana Auxiliadora

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Dulce Amistad. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños que son reconocidos en todo el país y por la calidez de su gente amable trabajadora.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Mariana, tiene 63 años de edad, está casada no ha podido tener hijos propios pero tiene dos que crio como que si fueran de ella, uno ya mayor de edad y una chica de 17 años que este año empieza a estudiar en la universidad, ambos  aun viven con ella. Su esposo es agricultor.

Ella es maestra jubilada y ahora se dedica a al comercio, tiene una tienda de comestibles en su casa en la cual también vende electrodomésticos y productos de bazar, trabaja todos los días desde las 7h00 hasta las 20h00 y su hija le ayuda en su negocio,  lleva con su negocio más de 12 años.
 
Este crédito es para comprar productos de primera necesidad para surtir su tienda y ciertos artículos de bazar. Es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y es la tesorera del mismo, lleva 10 ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos le han ayudado mucho.

Sus sueños son seguir trabajando y que cresca más su negocio.
texts.en:
Members of the communal bank 'Dulce Amistad' meet every fifteen days in the canton of Rocafuerte. This place is known for the delicious sweets its locals, who are known by the whole country to be warm, friendly, hard working people, prepare.

Here we met Mariana, who is 63 years old. She is married. She was not able to have children herself but she has raised two as if they were her own. One is now an adult and the other is a 17 year old girl who starts university this year. Both still live with her. Her husband is a farmer.

She is a retired teacher and now makes a living in retail. She has a food store in her house where she also sells electrical appliances and general items. She works every day from 7:00 am until 20:00 pm and her daughter helps her in this business. She has had this business for over 12 years.

This loan is to buy staples goods to stock her store and certain other items. She is a founding member of the communal bank and is its treasurer. She has been part of this communal bank for ten loan cycles and she likes it because the loan have helped her a lot.

Her dreams are to continue working and for her business to grow.

loans.use: to buy staples goods and items for her store.

loans.name: Fidelia Santusa

texts.es: La Sra. Fidelia tiene 47 años y es divorciada con un hijo que tiene 24 años, la señora tiene su puesto de abarrotes en el mercado de la zona, la Sra. Fidelia utilizara este préstamo para comprar mercadería abarrotes por mayor como fideo y arroz en cantidad y tenerlo almacenada  por estas épocas ya que esta subiendo  invertirá también en el mejoramiento de su puesto, Fidelia enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia, pero ella es muy conocida por sus clientes ya que vende muy bien y por esta  razón desea acumular mas mercadería para no dejar su puesto y tener que cerrar por comprar y utilizara los beneficios para  comprar mas mercadería, y así surtir su puesto de venta, Fidelia es una persona muy conocida y trabajadora se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Fidelia is 47 years old. She is divorced and has a 24 year old son. She has a grocery stall in the local market. Fidelia will use this loan to buy wholesale products such as noodles and rice in large quantities and have it stored for when its cost increases. She will also invest in improving her stall.

Fidelia faces challenges in her business such as competition, but she is known by her customers as a good seller and for this reason she wants to accumulate more supplies so as to not leave her stall and have to close in order to go and buy. She will use the profits gained to buy more supplies and stock her stall. Fidelia is a well known person who is hard working and she appreciates the helped provided by the MFI.

loans.use: to buy wholesale groceries for her stall.

loans.name: Raymond

texts.en:
Raymond is 38 years old and married to Peris. He has been operating a motorcycle transport business in Nakuru town for three years now.  Besides the motorcycle business, he also has a dairy shop. 

Raymond plans to use this loan amount to expand his dairy shop business by buying more stock of milk for sale.   In the future, Raymond hopes to open other businesses and become one of the leading businessmen in the region.

loans.use: buy milk

loans.name: Ignace

texts.en:
Ignace is single. He has been a rice farmer for 8 years. He would like to get this Kiva loan to buy fertilizers, seeds, and pay labor costs to get the best harvest.  With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been farming to get more output and make savings for a better future.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilisers, seeds and pay labor costs

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 50 years old.  She is married to her 54-year-old husband and together they have five children.  She owns a chemist shop and has been in the business for the past eight years.

This is Alice's first  loan in KADET LTD.  She was brought to KADET LTD by a staff member.  She will use this loan amount to purchase medicine to stock in her business.  She hopes to open a clinic in the area soon.

loans.use: buy medicine

loans.name: El Camino Group

texts.es:
El grupo el camino lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es la señora Martha Ruth de 47 años de edad la cual se dedica al comercio de ropa desde hace 3 años. Ella tiene 4 hijos ya todos mayores e independientes. El crédito lo invertirá en mercadería en ropa camisas, pantalones, shores, camisolas…etc.
Las otras integrantes son Fátima de 32 años vende nacatamales desde hace 4 años y Maribel quien compra y venta de envases desde hace 16 años.
texts.en:
'El Camino' group is formed by three hard working and enterprising women. One of them is Martha Ruth. She is 47 years old and she has made a living selling clothes for the past three years. She has four children, all of whom are adults and independent. She will invest this loan in buying stock such as shirts, trousers, shorts, camisoles... etc.

The other members of the group are Fátima, who is 32 years old and for the past 4 years has sold "nacatamales" and Maribel, who for the past 16 years has made a living buying and selling packaging.

loans.use: to buy stock such as shirts, trousers, shorts, camisoles... etc.

loans.name: Nieve Moncerrate

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Dulce Amistad. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños que son reconocidos en todo en todo el país y por la calidez de su gente amable trabajadora.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Nieve, tiene 53 años de edad,  hace varios años su esposo falleció y enviudo, pero de esta relación tuvo tres hijos, todos sus hijos ya son mayores de edad.
 
Ella para salir adelante se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, sus forma de venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa donde tiene un pequeño local hasta donde llegan sus clientes  a ver cuando trae nueva mercadería, la cual la comprar en Guayaquil. Trabaja todos los días en las mañanas,  deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días, tiene este negocio  por 15 años y gracias a él ha sacado adelante  a su familia.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace más de dos años  y le gusta porque el grupo que es muy unido.
 
Su sueño  es tener un almacén donde pueda vender sus productos.
texts.en:
Members of the communal bank 'Dulce Amistad' meet every fifteen days in the canton of Rocafuerte. This place is known for the delicious sweets its locals, who are known by the whole country to be warm, friendly, hard working people, prepare.

Here we met Nieve, who is 53 years old. Her husband died several years ago and left her a widow but from this relationship she had three children, all of whom are now adults.

In order to get ahead in life she makes a living selling all types of clothes. She sells both from door to door and in her house where she has a small shop where her customers come when she has new stock, which she buys in Guayaquil. She works every day in the mornings, leaves the items with her customers on credit and collects her payment every fifteen days. She has had this business for the past 15 years and thanks to it she has helped her family get ahead.

This loan is to buy more stock such as: trousers, blouses, T-shirts and children's clothes. She has been member of the communal bank for more than two years she likes it because the group is very united.

Her dream is to have a storeroom where she can sell her products.

loans.use: to buy trousers, blouses, T-shirts and children's clothes.

loans.name: Zamiri Group

texts.fr: La cliente Furaha, trésorière du groupe d’affaire «Zamiri », est  entrepreneur, âgée de 30  ans, mariée, mère de 6 jeunes enfants, qui étudient tous. Son mari fait de petits métiers. Elle est  vendeuse de friperie. Il y a  5 ans révolus qu’elle exerce ces petites activités génératrices de revenus de ce genre. Cependant, elle vient d’obtenir  son  20eme  crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec  1 ballon de friperies.  Ce dernier temps, cette cliente a constaté ses ventes baissées suite à la crise économique. En plus, elle souhaite  voir ses enfants grandir, les faire scolariser et accroitre son entreprise.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique.
texts.en:
Furaha is the treasurer of the ZAMIRI group.  She is a 30-year-old entrepreneur, married, and the mother of six young children who all attend school.  Her husband works odd jobs. 
 
Furaha sells used clothes.  She has been involved in this type of small income-generating activities for over 5 years.

She has just received her 20th loan from Hekima.  This new loan will allow her to purchase one bag of bulk used clothing.

Lately, Furaha has noticed a slump in her sales because of the economic crisis.  She would like to see her children grow and continue to attend school.  She would also like to expand her business.  

She thanks Hekima for its action in favor of poor women excluded from the traditional banking system.

loans.use: to buy one bag of bulk used clothing.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Johana María

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Dulce Amistad. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños que son reconocidos en todo en todo el país y por la calidez de su gente amable trabajadora.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Johana, tiene 30  años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen  un hijo de 12 años de edad que estudia en colegio. Su esposo es comerciante.
 
Ella hace varios años aprendió belleza en una academia de la localidad.  Tiene un salón de belleza en el cual  realiza diversos tipos de trabajo como: tinturados, cortes de cabellos, pintado de uñas y otros trabajos. Trabaja desde las 8h00 hasta las 21h00 y a veces hasta más tarde si sus clientes requieren de sus servicios. También vende ropa de todo tipo en su local ya que allí tiene unas vitrinas para mostrar sus prendas, las mismas que les da a sus clientes a crédito y que cobra cada 8 días,  lleva con su salón de belleza  más de 17 años y le ha ido muy bien.
  
Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar tintes, permanentes y ropa de todo tipo para sus ventas. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace cinco ciclos y le gusta porque  el banco le ha ayudado para aumentar su negocio.
 
Sus sueños son seguir adelante y aumentar su negocio.
texts.en:
Members of the communal bank 'Dulce Amistad' meet every fifteen days in the canton of Rocafuerte. This place is known for the delicious sweets its locals, who are known by the whole country to be warm, friendly, hard working people, prepare.

Here we met Johana who is 30 years old. She is married and from this relationship has a 12 year old son who studies at school. Her husband is a salesman.

Several years ago she took a beauty course at a local academy. She has a beauty salon where she carries out various types of work such as: hair dying, men's haircuts, hair painting and other jobs. She works from 8:00 am until 21:00 pm and sometimes later if her customers need her services. She also sells all sorts of clothes in her place of business as she has glass cabinets where she can display her items of clothing. She sells to her customers on credit and collect the payment every 8 days. She has worked in her beauty salon for more than 17 years and things have gone well for her.

This loan will be used to buy hair dyes, perms and all sorts of clothes to sell. She has been in this communal bank for more than five loan cycles and she likes it because the bank has helped her to increase her business.

Her dreams are to continue progressing and extending her business.

loans.use: to buy hair dyes, perms and clothes.

loans.name: Bénida

texts.fr:
Bénida est une femme âgé(e) de 36 ans. Elle est mariée å un  gestionnaire dans une banque de la place. 
Bénida travaille comme revendeuse de perles depuis 2006. Elle vend dans une boutique à toutes personnes. Sa difficulté principale est la mévente.
Bénida a requis son troisième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des perles pour revendre. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Bénida voudrait vendre ses perles à l’étranger. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit de perspectives d’avenir pour la famille.
texts.en:
Bénida is a 36-year-old woman.  She is married to a manager who works for a local bank.

Bénida has been working as a bead reseller since 2006.  She sells in a shop.  Her customers come from all walks of life.  Her main challenge is a slump in sales.

She has requested her third loan from WAGES in order to buy beads for resale.  She wants to reinvest in the activity.

In the coming years, Bénida would like to sell her beads abroad.  She says that her profits will allow her family to have a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy beads.

loans.name: Wendtoin Group

texts.fr:
Mme ASSETO est la responsable du groupe WENDTOIN. Elle est mariée et mère  de 06 enfants. Le plus âgée a 25ans et le moins âgée a 06ans. 02 de ses enfants vont à l’école  et  elle a 06 personnes à sa charge.

Mme vend du poisson frit  depuis 12 ans. Elle s’approvisionne à Dassasgo en ville. Ses clients sont ses  voisins et ses clients de tous les jours.

Mme veut  s’acheter  04sachets de poisson pour frire.

Elle utilise ses bénéfices  pour renforcer son activité car elle achetait à crédit. Mme ambitionne  s’acheter une moto pour facilité son activité.
texts.en: ASSETO is the group leader of the WENDTOIN group. She is married and the mother of 6 children. The eldest is 25 and the youngest 6 years old. 2 of her children go to school, and she has 6 dependents in her household. She has been selling fried fish for 12 years. She makes her purchases in the city in Dassago. Her customers are regulars and they are her neighbours. She wants to buy 4 bags of fish to fry. She uses her profits to strengthen her business, as she buys on credit. She hopes to buy a motorbike to make her work simpler.

loans.use: to purchase 4 bags of fish for frying

loans.name: Filomena

texts.es: La Sra. Filomena tiene 55 años no es casada pero es madre soltera con 3 hijos que son mayores de edad (independientes), ella se dedica a la venta de comida, en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en una zona muy concurrida de la ciudad de el Alto,  este préstamo es su segunda secuencia dentro de la institución, La Sra. Filomena utilizara este préstamo para la compra de material de construcción para la construcción de su vivienda y así poder vivir cómodamente, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es falta de capital, La Sra. Filomena enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia, ya que hay muchos lugares donde venden comida por esta zona, pero aun así tiene mas venta, la Sra. Filomena se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Filomena is 55 years old. She is not married but is a single mother with three children who are now adults (independent). She makes a living selling food in her stall which is in a busy city in Alto. This loan is her second cycle with the MFI. Filomena will use this loan to buy construction materials to build a house to be able to live comfortably. Her reason for requesting this loan is lack of capital. Filomena faces challenges in her business such as competition as there are many places which sells food in the area. However, Filomena has good sales and she feels happy and grateful to the MFI for the support given to her.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to build a house.

loans.name: Corazon De Jesus Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formo a través de la Sra. Anacleta y la Sra. Victoria, quienes se habían acercado hasta la Oficina de la Fundación Paraguaya y así decidieron formar el grupo,  son 26 mujeres trabajadoras y humildes que deben ganarse el sustento todos los días. Ellas  son independientes en sus labores, pero también hacen actividades juntas.
La Sra. Victoria se dedica a la cría y venta de pollo, y nos cuenta que es muy sacrificado, pues debe de estar pendiente siempre de sus animales. Este trabajo le ayuda a poder seguir trabajando y de esa forma mantener a sus familiares.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de pollitos para la cría y también alimentos para estos, lo cual le será de mucha ayuda en sus proyectos de trabajo.
texts.en:
This committee was created by Anacleta and Victoria, who went to the office of the Fundación Paraguaya, and from there, they decided to form the group. The group has 26 hard working, humble woman who must earn a living each day. They are independent in their work, but they also do some activities together. 

Victoria raises and sells chickens. She says that the work requires much sacrifice because she must be constantly devoted to her animals. This work allows her to continue working and thus support her family. 

She is requesting the loan to purchase chicks to raise, as well as food for them, which will be a big help for her in her work projects.

loans.use: Purchase chicks to raise and chicken feed for the chicks

loans.name: Grey Del Rocio

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Dulce Amistad. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños que son reconocidos en todo en todo el país y por la calidez de su gente amable trabajadora.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Grey, tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos de 22, 18, 16 y 12 años de edad, los mismos que estudian dos en Universidad y dos en colegio, todos sus hijos aun viven con ella. Su esposo es chofer.

Ella es un ama de casa que para ganar sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de sandalias, agua en bidón y productos Avon (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas).  Tiene un pequeño local en su casa donde vende todos sus productos aunque a veces también sale a hacer sus recorridos, trabaja todos los días desde las 8h30 hasta las 17h00, lleva 6 años dedicada a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar sandalias, perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos, cremas y otros productos. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 6 ciclos y le gusta por la ayuda que recibe con los créditos.
 
Su sueño es tener una farmacia.
texts.en:
Members of the communal bank 'Dulce Amistad' meet every fifteen days in the canton of Rocafuerte. This place is known for the delicious sweets its locals, who are known by the whole country to be warm, friendly, hard working people, prepare.

Here we met Grey. She is 40 years old, married and from this relationship has four children, aged 22, 18, 16 and 12. Two of them study at university and two at school. All her children still live with her. Her husband is a chauffeur. 

She is a housewife who in order to earn her own money makes a living selling sandals, barrels of water and Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and women's accessories). She has a small space in her house where she sells all her products although sometimes she also travels round to see her customers. She works every day from 8:30 am until 17:00 pm. She has carried out this activity for the past 6 years and things are going well.

She will use this loan to buy sandals, perfumes, imitation jewellery, cosmetics, creams and other products. She has been in this communal bank for the past 6 loan cycles and she likes it because of the help she receives with the loans.

Her dream is to have a pharmacy.

loans.use: to buy sandals, perfumes, imitation jewellery, cosmetics, creams, etc.

loans.name: Divina Misericordia Group

texts.es:
15 mujeres de la ciudad de Curuguaty, se unieron con las ganas de salir adelante y apoyarse las unas a las otras, y de esa forma brindarles un mejor futuro a sus familias. Actualmente se encuentran en en el segundo ciclo, y su meta es poder llegar al nivel máximo del programa.
Unice, es una de las integrantes, y nos cuenta que se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de prendas usadas, comenta que le va muy bien, puesto que la venta de ropas usadas tiene muy buena demanda. Ya que siempre tiene muy lindas ropas y gracias a la calidad y buen precio de las mismas, ha podido formarse ya una buena clientela.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas, con las cuales podrá tener mas en stock y de esa forma tener mas clientes. Ellas están contentas por la ayuda que están recibiendo por parte de kiva y de fundación paraguaya.
texts.en:
15 women from the city of Curuguaty met up with the desire to get ahead and support each other and in this way provide a better future for their families. At the moment she is in her second loan cycle and her goal is to be able to get to her maximum level in the program.

Unice is one of the members and she tells us that she makes a living selling all sorts of used clothing. She comments that it is going very well, given that the sales of used clothing has a high demand. As she always has pretty clothes and thanks to the quality and good price of these, she has been able to form a good clientèle.

She requests this loan to buy items of clothing with which she will have more stock and so have more customers. She is very happy for the help they are receiving from Kiva and Fundación Paraguaya.

loans.use: to buy clothing items for resale.

loans.name: Gisele

texts.fr:
Cliente de 38 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants étant tous sur le banc de l'école. Il y'a de cela 3 ans ,elle a commence a vendre  la viande de brousse , les gibiers qu'elle allait acheter dans les villages forestiers  et elle livrait ses produits aux restaurateurs et foyers qui aiment ce genre de mets , son activité a bien marche  et elle a eu a faire des ventes de 50.000 fs a 200.000  frs par jour.

Elle a remboursée ses prêts avec succès et a fait des épargnes considérables et en ce qui concerne sa vie familiale, elle nous dit qu'elle a pu améliorer les conditions sociales et a aide son mari pour payer les frais d'écolages et ils sont entrain d'investir pour construire une nouvelle maison.

Avec ses épargnes et son nouveau prêt,elle vient de lancer une nouvelle activité et  elle a ouvert un dépôt de ciment , elle a acheter 5 tonnes de ciments pour un début,et elle continue a gérer les deux activités celui de la vente de la viande de brousse et la vente de ciment simultanément.

Tres fière d'elle , elle veut aller loin dans son commerce et veut être une importatrice de ciment dans les années avenir
texts.en:
The client is 38 years old, married and the mother of 5 children - all of whom are in school. 3 years ago, she began selling bushmeat and game that she goes to buy in the forest villages, and she then delivers these products to restaurants and households who appreciate this sort of food. This business has worked well and she has generated daily sales of 50,000 to 200,000 frs.
She has successfully repaid her loans, and has built up considerable savings; in terms of the family's living standards, she tells us she has been able to improve the social conditions and has helped her husband in paying the school fees, and they are in the process of saving to build a new home.
With her savings and this new loan, she has recently begun a new business and has opened a cement store. She has bought 5 tonnes of cement to start with, and she is continuing to manage both businesses at the same time - the sale of bushmeat and the sale of cement. She is highly self confident, and wants to progress her business, becoming a cement importer in the future.

loans.use: to purchase 5 tonnes of sacks of cement.

loans.name: Assana

texts.fr:
Assana est une femme âgée de 51 ans. Elle est mariée å un revendeur. Elle a 3 enfants. 
Assana travaille comme revendeuse depuis 1992. Elle vend des tissus pour tous clients au grand marché de Lomé. Elle achète les produits au grand marché de Lomé. Elle travaille avec 01 personne. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est de ne pouvoir pas satisfaire toutes les demandes.
Assana a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des coupons de soie et de popeline. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Assana voudrait agrandir la taille de l’activité en ouvrant une boutique.
texts.en:
Assana is a 51-year-old woman.  She is married to a reseller and has three children.

She has been working as a reseller since 1992. She buys and sells fabrics at the Grand Market in Lomé.  Her customers come from all walks of life.  She works with one person.  Currently, her main challenge is that she cannot meet all of the demand. 

Assana has requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy sets of silk and poplin.  She wants to reinvest in her activity.

In the coming years, Assana would like to expand her business and open a shop.

loans.use: to buy fabrics.

loans.name: Las Aguilas Group

texts.es:
El grupo las Águilas lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Indiana quien es estilista y vende cosméticos desde hace 10 años. Ella invertirá el préstamo en productos de belleza y su meta es tener un salón.
Las otras integrantes son Aracely quien tiene una pulpería y Jesica de 26 años quien tiene un kiosko, vende prendas de oro y plata y ropa.
texts.en:
'Las Águilas' group is formed by three hard working and enterprising women. One of them is Indiana who is a stylist and she has sold cosmetics for the past 10 years. She will invest the loan in beauty products and her goal is to have a salon.

The other members are Aracely who has a general store, and Jesica, 26 years old, who has a kiosk, and sells gold and silver items and clothes.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Nere 02 Group

texts.fr:
Mme AMINATA  est la représentante du groupe NEERE 02. Elle est mariée et n’a pas d’enfant. Personne ne  va à l’école et elle a 02 personnes à sa charge.

Mme est couturière  depuis  2008 soit (04ans). Elle s’approvisionne  dans une boutique au  secteur 17 en ville. Ses clients sont les amis et les voisins.

Mme veut  s’acheter  une machine à coudre ; 10 roulettes à fils et ½ douzaine de tissus.

Elle  épargne ses bénéfices et aide à la scolarisation des enfants. Mme ambitionne  acquérir  d’autres machines  à coudre  et ouvrir  un grand atelier pour son activité.
texts.en: AMINATA  is the representative of the NEERE 02 group. She is married and has no children. Nobody goes to school and she has 2 dependents. She has been a seamstress since 2008 (4 years). She buys her supplies in a store in sector 17 in the city. Her customers are friends and neighbours. She wants to buy a sewing machine, 10 reels of cotton and half a dozen pieces of cloth. She saves her profits, and helps to put children through school. Her ambition is to get more sewing machines and to open a big workshop for her business.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine, 10 reels of cotton and half a dozen cloths.

loans.name: La Union Group

texts.es:
El comité está compuesto por 10 integrantes de la ciudad de Encarnación. El comité  está tratando de promover su trabajo grupal, ya que  son pocos los  meses  que trabajan juntas, se reúnen cada semana para compartir, comunicar e interiorizarse de las novedades que se generan dentro del grupo.
Una de las miembros es catalina, y ella nos comenta que tiene una despensa bien surtida, de donde compran sus vecinos y personas de zonas aledañas. Es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, y tiene muchas ganas de progreso y un gran espíritu emprendedor. Su meta es seguir agrandandando su local, y de esa forma ir progresando como microempresario.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de comestibles, bebidas, lateos y demás insumos, con los cuales podrá abastcerse y de esa forma tener bien surtida su despensa.
texts.en:
This communal bank is formed by 10 member from the city of Encarnación. The communal bank is trying to promote teamwork. As they have only worked together for a few months they meet every week to share, communicate and take in the new changes within the group.

One of their members is Catalina. She tells us that she has a well stocked store, where her neighbours and people from nearby areas come to buy. She is a hard working and enterprising woman who has desires to progress and a great enterprising spirit. Her goal is to continue extending her store and in this way to progress as a micro businesswoman.

She is requesting a loan to buy foodstuffs, drinks, dairy products and other supplies, which will stock her store and give her a good range of products to offer.

loans.use:
Comprar insumos para la despensa.
to buy supplies for her

loans.name: Reinaldo Noguera

texts.es:
El Señor Reinaldo tiene 28 años de edad, está acompañado con la señora Gloria, tienen un hijo, viven en la ciudad de Villarrica. El cuenta que se dedica a la venta de artículos electrónicos como ser DvD´s, Cd´s, equipos de sonido, Pendrives, Blue-Ray y ya que el negocio es rentable está en constante crecimiento, tiene como clientes a los Funcionarios de una empresa con muchos empleados de esa ciudad, que son clientes seguros.
El nos dice que todo el esfuerzo que hace es por darle a su familia todo lo mejor, que no tengan que pasar por privaciones y necesidades, es por ello que siempre se esfuerza al máximo en todo momento.
El solicita préstamo para la compra de pendrives, Cd´s, DvD´s y demás artículos que vende y así podrá generar más ingresos y mejorar su nivel de vida y la de su familia. El señor agradece a la Fundación por haberle otorgado esta oportunidad de crecimiento.
texts.en:
Reinaldo is 28 years old. His partner is Gloria, they have a son and live in the city of Villarrica. He tells us that he makes a living selling electronic goods such as DVDs, CDs, sound equipment, pen drives, Blue-ray. His business is profitable and in constant growth. He has customers who include government workers in a company who has many employees in this city, who are certain customers.

He tells us that all the effort he makes is to give his family the best, so that they don't have to go without anything or in need. This is why he always gives his all at all times.

He is requesting a loan to buy pen drives, CDs, DVDs and other articles that he sells. In this way he will be able to generate more income and improve his and his family's standard of living. He appreciates this chance to progress given to him by the MFI.

loans.use: to buy pen drives, Cd´s, DvD´s and other articles.

loans.name: Oulèye

texts.fr:
Madame Oulèye est une brave femme qui s’active dans l’agriculture depuis plus de 15 ans. Elle possède un champ qui se trouve à environ 22 km de la ville principale. Elle est à son 4ème crédit à l’IMCEC  et aimerait renouveler pour acheter des semences et des intrants agricoles mais aussi construire un bassin pour l’irrigation complète de toute la surface  cultivée. 
Comme on voit sur la photo, elle est partie acheter du ciment  pour entamer d’abord  les travaux de maçonnerie du bassin. Avec le crédit, elle va aussi acheter 4 pots  de semences de choux, 100 litres de gasoil, 15 sacs de fumier et un litre de produit photo-sanitaire.
Dans le foyer, c’est elle qui assure la dépense quotidienne : l’achat des denrées alimentaires (riz, huile, sucre).Elle pense aussi dans l’avenir, construire un bâtiment  dans la maison familiale.
texts.en:
Oulèye is a decent woman who has been involved in agriculture for more than 15 years. She owns a field about 22kms from the main town. She is on her fourth consecutive loan from IMCEC and would like to renew it again in order to purchase cabbage seeds, and some agricultural inputs - but also to build a reservoir to completely irrigate the cultivated area.
As we see from the photo, she has bought the cement to begin the work of building the reservoir. With the loan, she is also going to buy 4 pots of cabbage seeds, 100 litres of diesel, 15 bags of manure and a litre of phyto-sanitary product. She is responsible for the household expenses : purchase of foodstuffs (rice, oil, sugar). In the future she hopes to build a building in the family home.

loans.use: to purchase cabbage seeds, inputs (diesel, manure); also to purchase cement to build the reservoir.

loans.name: Roger Gauto

texts.es:
El Sr. Roger es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Encarnación. Comenta que se dedica al comercio, ya que tiene un local comercial en el circuito comercial en donde vende articulo de bazar hace mas de 15 años, por lo que ya tiene mucha experiencia en el ramo.
Gracias a los años que lleva trabajando en esto, ya ha podido formarse una clientela bien definida, que siempre compra de él, lo que lo ayuda a tener como un ingreso seguro. Comenta que su meta es tener un gran local donde poder tener más productos que pueda ofrecer a sus clientes.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de cubiertos, platos, ollas, sartenes y demás, con lo que podrá seguir vendiendo y generando ingresos. El está muy agradecido por la oportunidad que recibe de fundación paraguaya y de kiva.
texts.en:
Roger is single and lives in the city of Encarnación. He comments that he makes a living in retail. He has a small shop in a commercial area where he has sold store items for more than 15 years, so he has a lot of experience in this branch.

Thanks to the years he has dedicated to this activity he has been able to form a good customer base who always buy from him. This helps him to have a sure income. He mentions that his goal is have a bigger store where he can have more products to offer to his customers.

He is requesting this loan to buy cutlery, plates, pots and pans and other items, with which he will be able to continue selling and generating income. He is very grateful for the opportunity given to him by Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy articles (cutlery, plates, pots and pans and other items) to sell in his store.

loans.name: Villa De Suerte Group

texts.es:
El grupo Villa de Suerte está conformado por tres mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas es Janeth del Socorro de 41 años, tiene una pequeña venta la cual inicio con la venta de mango y poco a poco fue ampliándolo. Ella tiene tres hijos de 19, 14 y 8 años los cuales estudian.
Las otras integrantes son Sandra de 42 años quien tiene una pulpería hace 4 años y Gloria de 38 años comercializa sandalias desde hace 3 años.
texts.en:
Group 'Villa de Suerte' is formed by three hard working women. One of them is Janeth del Socorro, who is 41 years old. She has a small store which she started by selling mango and little by little extended. She has three children aged 19, 14 and 8 who study.

The other members are Sandra, 42 years old, who has a small general store, and Gloria, 38 years old, who has sold sandals for the past three years.

loans.use: to buy basic grains

loans.name: Davy Rodel

texts.fr:
Client de 35 ans, marie et père d'un enfant,il a commence a vendre de l'huile d'arachide en détail il ya de cela plus de vingt  ans et il était encore très jeune .

Ayant deja bénéficie de plusieurs prêts , il a deja  réalisé des grands benefices et a rembourse avec succès ces deux précédents prêts .

A l'octroi de son nouveau prêt, il va acheter 15 bidons de 25 litres d'huile d'arachide qu'il va acheter chez  les grossistes et il vend en détail chez ses potentiels clients.ses recettes sont de 30.000 frs a 75.000  frs par jour, il a des énormes benefices et il fait ses repayements sans trop de difficultés.

A l'avenir il veut être grossiste , avoir un magasin de vente d'huile et s'occuper aussi de sa famille et de leur scolarité
texts.en:
Davy Rodel is 35 years old, married and the father of one child. He started retailing peanut oil more than twenty years ago, when he was still very young. Having already had several loans in the past, he has already made substantial profits and has successfully repaid his last two loans.
On receipt of this latest loan, he will buy 15 x 25 litre cans of peanut oil which he will buy from wholesalers, and will resell via retail to his potential customers. His income varies from 30,000 to 75,000 frs per day; he makes huge profits and can meet his repayments without too much difficulty. In the future, he wants to be a wholesaler, to have a shop selling oil, and to take care of his family and schooling of his child(ren).

loans.use: to buy 15 x 25 litres cans of peanut oil and 10 x 25 litre cans of palm oil.

loans.name: María Dolores

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Dulce Amistad. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños que son reconocidos en todo en todo el país y por la calidez de su gente amable trabajadora.

En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 36 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 17, 15 y 12 años  de edad, todos estudian en colegio. Su esposo es chofer y trabaja en el Municipio de Rocafuerte.

Ella es una muy buena madre y ama de casa que para ayudar a su esposo en los gastos familiares se dedica al comercio, vende productos por catalogo de la marca Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los días de dos a tres horas al dia de preferencia en las mañanas, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana o cada quince de acuerdo a lo que quieran sus clientes.  Lleva 1 año con su negocio y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos y cremas. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace casi tres años y le gusta por la ayuda que les brinda la institución. 

Su sueño es ver que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y sean buenos profesionales,
texts.en:
The members of the communal bank Dulce Amistad get together every 15 days in the Rocafuerte canton. This place is known for its delicious sweets which are prepared by locals and are well known throughout the country. The place is also known for its friendly, warm, and hardworking people. 

Maria lives here. She is 36 and married. She and her husband have three children, ages 17, 15, and 12 years old who are all in school. Her husband is a driver and works in the Rocafuerte Municipaliy. Maria is a very good mother and home maker. In order to support her husband and contribute to the household expenses, she sells Avon beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and lady’s accessories using a catalogue. She works for about two to three hours every day, preferably in the morning. She sells her products on credit and collects every week to fifteen days according to her customers’ preferences. She has been running this business for one year, and it has been going very well. 

She will use the loan to purchase perfumes, costume jewellery, cosmetics, and creams. She has been a member of the communal bank for three years, and she likes it because of the support that the institution provides her. 

Her dream is to see her children finish their studies and become good professionals.

loans.use: purchase perfumes, costume jewellry, cosmetics, and creams

loans.name: Angelica María

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Dulce Amistad. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños que son reconocidos en todo en todo el país y por la calidez de su gente amable trabajadora.

En este lugar vive la señora Angélica, tiene 23 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual  tienen una hija de tres meses  de edad, la cual requiere de muchos cuidados. Su marido es mecánico.

Ella es una joven madre y ama de casa que para obtener sus propios ingresos y con esto poder ayudar a su esposo en los gastos familiares se dedica al comercio, vende ropa por catalogo y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta,  trabaja tres días a la semana de dos a tres horas al dia de preferencia en las mañanas, ya que a esta hora su mamá le cuida a su bebé, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana o cada quince de acuerdo a lo que quieran sus clientes.  Lleva 4 años con su negocio y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar pantalones, camisas, blusas, entre otras prendas. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace dos ciclos y le gusta por la ayuda que les brinda la institución.
 
Sus sueños son seguir adelante en su negocio y que a su bebé no le falte nada.
texts.en:
Members of the communal bank 'Dulce Amistad' meet every fifteen days in the canton of Rocafuerte. This place is known for the delicious sweets its locals, who are known by the whole country to be warm, friendly, hard working people, prepare.

This is where Angélica lives. She is 23 years old and lives in free union from which she has a three month old daughter, who requires a lot of care. Her husband is a mechanic.

She is a young mother and housewife who obtains her own income and with this she can help her husband with the household bills. She makes a living in retail. She sells catalogue clothes and she does this door to door. She works three days a week between two and three hours a day preferably in the mornings, as this is when her mother can look after her baby. She leaves her products on credit and collects payment every week or every fifteen days depending on what her customers want. She has worked in this business for four years and it is going well.

She will use this loan to buy trousers, shirts, blouses and other items of clothing. She has been a member of this communal bank for two loan cycles and she likes it for the help given by the MFI.

Her dreams are to continue ahead with her business and that her baby doesn't go without anything.

loans.use: to buy trousers, shirts, blouses and other items of clothing.

loans.name: Sara

texts.es:
La señora Sara tiene 71 años de edad, está casada desde hace tiempo con el señor Carlos, ellos viven en su casa de Encarnación. La señora Sara es propietaria de una Farmacia que tienen en su casa, se dedica a este comercio desde hace varios años y tiene mucha clientela de la zona. Su esposo es Jubilado y colabora en la casa y en el negocio. Tienen hijos ya adultos e independientes. Gracias a este trabajo ellos han podido salir adelante y mantener su hogar.
La señora Sara se define como una persona muy trabajadora que desea seguir luchando y de esa forma tener una vejez digna, sin privaciones.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de medicamentos en general, con lo cual podrá tener un buen stock y de esa forma poder cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Sara is 71 years old. She has been married for some time to Carlos and they live in their house in Encarnación. Sara is the owner of a pharmacy which she has in her house. She has made a living in this activity for several years and has many customers in the area. Her husband is retired and helps out in the house and the business. They have children who are adults and independent. Thanks to this job they have been able to get ahead and keep their house.

Sara considers herself to be a hard working person who wants to continue fighting and spend her old age in a dignified way, without lacking anything.

She requests this loan to buy medicines in general, with which she will be able to have a good stick and be able to comply with her customers demands.

loans.use: to buy medicine to sell.

loans.name: Daniela Burgos

texts.es:
La Sra. Daniela tiene 47 años de edad, es de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, ella trabajo desde muy joven en el rubro de la confección y después de casarse monto una despensa con la que cuenta actualmente.
La Sr.a Daniela ya tiene una clientela bien formada en los alrededores del barrio, con este trabajo logro mejorar su vivienda y ayudarle a su marido con los gastos del día a día.
El necesita de este crédito para la compra de productos de primera necesidad, con los cuales podrá abastecer su despensa, estos productos son: azúcar fideos, porotos, legumbres y demás. Ella agradece a la fundación por la oportunidad que ha recibido, pues le será de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
47-year-old Daniela is from the city of San Lorenzo.  She worked as a dressmaker from a very young age then, after she got married, she set up a grocery store which she still runs. 

Daniela has a well-established customer base in the area surrounding her neighborhood.  Through her work, she has been able to improve her home and help her husband with their daily expenses.

Daniela needs this loan to buy basic household products with which to stock her store: sugar, noodles, beans, vegetables, etc.  She is grateful to Fundación  Paraguaya for the opportunity that they have given her as it will be a great help.

loans.use: to buy products for her grocery store

loans.name: Lisandro Ortega

texts.es:
El Sr. Lisandro es de la ciudad de Pilar, es soltero, nos comenta que es comerciante, además posee un centro comercial situado en el pueblo de lomasgrande, es un centro comercial donde se comercializa todo tipos de ropas ya sea para damas, caballeros, etc.
Vive en casa  de su madre, la comercialización de sus productos los realiza en toda la ciudad y nos comenta que se dedica a esto hace tres años, por lo cual ya tiene un poco de experiencia en esto.
El mismo solicita el préstamo para invertir en su comercio, ya que desea tener más prendas, las cuales les ayudara a poder tener más variedad para ofrecer a sus clientes. El agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la oportunidad recibida.
texts.en:
Lisandro is from the city of Pilar.  He is single.  He tells us that he is a salesman and also owns a store in the small town of Lomasgrande where he sells all kinds of men's and women's clothing.  He lives in his mother's home and sells his products throughout the city.  He tells us that he has been in this business for three years and so he already has some experience.

Lisandro is requesting this loan to invest in his business because he would like to buy more garments and thereby have a wider variety to sell to his customers.  He is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for the opportunity he is receiving.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Melchora Ortiz

texts.es:
La Sra. Melchora, es comerciante, tiene su negocio en su domicilio. Ella tiene una despensa y carnicería bien surtidas, con buen movimiento comercial ya que esta en una zona muy recurrida, tiene una clientela formada, quienes son pasajeros, militares, excombatiente, asalariados, etc. EI marido de ella se dedica a la ganadería, tiene un pequeño establecimiento en una zona aledaña.
Nos cuenta que tiene como objetivo mantener  y fortalecer su puesto de trabajo, por esta razón ha recurrido a la fundación y agradece para darle la oportunidad de obtener este crédito para abastecer cada día más su negocio con comestibles, bebidas, lácteos y demás insumos necesarios, que salen día a día. Ella agradece a la fundación y a Kiva por la oportunidad que está recibiendo.
texts.en:
Melchora is a shopkeeper whose business is located in her home.  She has a well-stocked grocery store and butcher's shop and makes a lot of sales because she lives in a very busy area.  She has an established customer base made up of passengers, soldiers, veterans, wage earners, etc.  Her husband raises livestock and has a small establishment in a neighboring area.

Melchora tells us that her goal is to maintain and strengthen her work place.  This is why she has come to Fundación Paraguaya and she is grateful to them for having given her the opportunity to obtain this loan for stocking her business with foodstuffs, drinks, dairy products and other products that she sells every day.  She is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for the opportunity that she is receiving.

loans.use: to buy products for her store

loans.name: Los Tres Girasoles Group

texts.es:
El grupo los tres girasoles lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Janeth del Carmen quien se dedica a la venta de ropa y repostería desde hace 10 años los cuales comercializa en Granada y Nindiri. El crédito lo invertirá en pantalones y ropa para verano.
Las otras integrantes son Gladis quien vende nacatamales desde hace 30 años y Alicia  tiene una fritanga y vende ropa.
texts.en:
The Tres Girasoles [Three Sunflowers] group is made up of three hardworking and enterprising women. One of them is Janeth del Carmen, who has sold clothes and pastries for 10 years in Granada and Nindiri. She will invest the loan in pants and summer clothing.  

The other members are Gladis, who has sold nacatamales for 30 years, and Alicia, who sells fried food and clothes.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as clothing, especially pants and summer clothing.

loans.name: Milciades Benitez

texts.es:
Milciades tiene 33 años vive con su padre en la ciudad de Carapeguá, es soltero, se dedica como vendedor ambulante en las ciudades de Caaguazú, Coronel Oviedo y alrededores, específicamente hace mas de 10 años.
Se dedico a este trabajo ya que su padre  se dedica a esto y tiene muchos parientes en la ciudad de Caaguazú. Fue su padre quien le inculco ya que el también va a esa zona a trabajar también como macatero y manejan un buen número de clientes y es una zona que está creciendo económicamente.
Solicito el préstamo para la compra de productos en general como hamacas, colchas, Sobrecamas, championes, remeras y  así poder cubrir las demandas de pedidos que tiene con su clientela y poder crecer más económicamente y en lo que se refiere en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Milciades is 33 years old and lives with his father in the city of Carapeguá. He is single and a street vendor in the cities of Caaguazú, Coronel Oviedo and the surrounding areas. He has done this for more than 10 years.

He does this work because his father does it and he has a lot of relatives in the city of Caaguazú. His father got him started since he works in this area too as a street vendor and they have a good number of customers and the area is growing economically.  

He asked for the loan to buy general products such as hammocks, blankets, bed covers, sneakers, and t-shirts. This way, he can cover his orders from the customers and grow more economically in his work.

loans.use: to buy hammocks, blankets, bed covers, sneakers, t-shirts, etc.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 49-year-old lady from Vihiga and a mother of four children. She is married to Alfred who is a civil servant.

Jane runs a retail shop, a business she has been operating for the last eight years, and makes a monthly income of about KES 39,000. She is now taking her fourth loan from KADET LTD which she will use to buy retail stock of sugar, cooking oil and other household goods to sell. She will use the expected profits to educate her children.

Her dream is to expand her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: To buy retail stock of sugar, cooking oil and other household goods to sell.

loans.name: Munene

texts.en: Munene is a 30-year-old single man. He has no children yet. He describes himself to be hardworking. He operates a pharmacy where he sells drugs. He has been involved in this business for 1 year. His primary customers are patients. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more drugs. Munene's business goal is to expand his business within 5 years. He hopes that in the future he will run another pharmacy.

loans.use: to buy more drugs.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
This is Norma, 46, a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Edilberto, 48, a mechanic, and is a mother of six children. Two of the children are working, two are in high school and the remaining two stay at home. She keeps herself busy attending to her kids and doing business as her way of helping her husband sustain daily expenses. 

Norma is into a rug business. She cuts and sews scrap textiles that she purchases in garment factories. She makes different kinds and sizes of rugs. She makes door mats, pot holders and rugs that are being used by drivers in cleaning their vehicles. Her regular customers are the drivers that pass through the area where she sells her items. She also has clients in the market that regularly order rugs from her. Aside from this she also retails mineral water for additional income. She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a Php16,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more scrap textiles that she will make into rugs. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.  

Norma dreams that all her children will finish their studies and have a good job. She hopes to maintain good income from her business that will help her to provide a comfortable life for her kids. She faithfully attends the weekly fellowship* meeting that allows her to give of her own share of God’s love and care in her life. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah is 31 years old and married with 2 children. She sells timber to earn a living. She has been in the business for 2 years and has employed one person. She describes her business environment as busy, because she has many regular customers. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to improve her business and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 80,000 Kenya Shillings to buy timber to sell.

loans.use: To buy timber to sell.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 32 years old and is a married woman with 2 children, aged 8 and 6. She has had her sari-sari (variety) store business for 8 months. She sells soy sauce, vinegar, salt, canned goods and other various items that her customers regularly buy from her. She earns about 7,000 PHP per month with her business.

Evangeline needs additional capital for her store. She applied for a loan to buy more items to sell, such as canned goods and toiletries. She hopes to save for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell, such as canned goods and toiletries.

loans.name: Gaudentia

texts.en:
Gaudentia is a 60-year-old widowed lady and the mother of two grown up children, and she hails from Western Kenya.

Gaudentia operates a welding workshop, a business she has been running for the last eight years. She makes a monthly income of about KES 17,000. She is a longtime client of KADET LTD and she is taking her eighth loan, which she will use to buy metals for the welding shop. She will use her profits to pay back the loan.

Her dream is to grow her business through KADET funding.

loans.use: To buy metals for the welding shop.

loans.name: Muraz Musaev

texts.en:
Muraz is 28 years old. He lives in a small village in East Georgia. Muraz is unmarried and lives with his family – his mother and a 26-year-old brother. 

Agriculture is the main source of income for the family. They have 3 milk cows and 4 calves. Muraz’s mother produces cheese and sells it on the local open market. The family also sells calves. Along with the above mentioned, Muraz owns 2 mini-buses, which are rented out, and the rent is additional income for him. The total average monthly income of the family is 1,200 Laris.

Muraz requested credit for purchasing calves. He will grow them for 5-6 months and then sell the grown calves in early fall for a higher price. The family will get additional income, which will allow them to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase calves.

loans.name: Bebelyn

texts.en:
This is Bebelyn, 47, a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Joerico, 43, a carpenter, and the mother to her children. She keeps herself busy attending to the needs of her family and her business. 

Bebelyn is into a rug business. She cuts and sews scrap textiles that she purchases in garment factories. She makes different kinds and sizes of rugs. She makes door mats, pot holders and rugs that are being used by drivers for cleaning their vehicles. Her regular customers are the drivers that pass through the area where she sells her items. She also has clients in the market that regularly order rugs from her. She earns a minimum of Php 800 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 8,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more scrap textiles that she will make into rugs. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.  

Bebelyn dreams that all her children will finish their studies. She hopes that her business will continue to grow. She wants her family to enjoy a comfortable life. She faithfully attends the weekly fellowship* meeting that allows her to share God’s love and care in her life. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Mañaneras Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MAÑANERAS” iniciará el decimo primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de de Villa Exaltación.  Está compuesta por ocho integrantes y cuentan con una mesa directiva a la cabeza de la misma se encuentra  la señora Martha. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de verduras, venta de vajillas, tienda de abarrotes, venta de mantas, venta de café, ladrillera, venta de calzados, tienda de abarrotes, venta de cosméticos, almacén, venta de ropa, venta de artículos varios, venta de DVD’s.

La señora Martha, indica que hace seis meses que conforma una asociación comunal desde y que en la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio de venta de DVD’s, que viene trabajando hace años. El crédito de este ciclo es para ampliación de su mercadería (compra de DVD’s) que adquiere de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto fijo. Esta forma de trabajo le permite apoyar a su familia pues ella es casada y tiene seis hijos.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las reuniones.

En la fotografía no se encuentra el señor Abel, por razones personales.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Mañaneras" or "Morning women" will begin it's 11th cycle with Kiva field partner Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal (Focal center) of the village Exaltación.  This bank is made up of 8 people and has a governing board.  The head of the board is Mrs. Martha.  The businesses that the communal bank members carry forward are varied, and among them we have: selling vegetables, selling dishes, running a grocery store, selling table cloths, selling coffee, brick work, selling undergarments, running another grocery store, running a grocer's shop, selling clothes, selling various articles, and selling DVD's.  

Mrs. Martha indicates that six months ago the group was formed and since that time until now she has been selling DVD's, something she has been doing for many years.  The loan requested is to increase merchandise (to purchase DVD's) that she buys in the city of El Alto, and then later to sell them in her regular stall.  This form of work allows her to support her family since she is married and has six children.  

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the meetings.  

In the photograph Mr. Abel is not pictured for personal reasons.

loans.use: To purchase DVD's

loans.name: Edith Del Rosario Guadalupe

texts.es:
En la parroquia Andrés De Vera de la ciudad de  Portoviejo, conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen  cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal 4 De Agosto.

La señora Edith es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos ella ha podido mejorar su negocio y su situación económica. Tiene 53 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene seis hijos, cinco de ellos ya son mayores de edad, el menor tiene 16 años, dos de ellos estudian en universidad y colegio y aun viven con ella los dos menores. Su esposo es vendedor de seguros.
 
Ella hace varios años aprendió corte y confección en una academia de la localidad. Tiene un pequeño taller de costura en su casa en el cual se dedica a confeccionar todo tipo de ropa, pero lo que más le gusta elaborar es ropa de mujer o de niñas, trabaja a base de pedidos de personas particulares y en la actualidad tiene un contrato con el Estado para elabora uniformes para escuelas y colegios, con ella trabaja una de sus hijas a quien le paga por su trabajo. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 22h00 y a veces hasta más tarde cuando tiene pedidos que entregar.  Tiene más de 15 años realizando esta labor y le ha ido muy bien.

Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar telas, hilos, botones  y otros materiales para la costura.
 
Sus sueños son tener un taller más grande y cumplir a tiempo con sus obras ya que tiene bastante por entregar.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the '4 de Agosto' community bank meet in Andrés De Vera parish, in the city of Portoviejo.  This city has been known for many years as the 'City of the Royal Tamarind Trees'.

Edith is a founding member of this community bank and she likes it because she has been able to improve her business and her financial situation through the loans.  She is 53 years old, married, and has six children.  Five of her children are already adults and her youngest [son] is 16 years old.  Two of her children are studying at university and high school and the two youngest still live with her.  Her husband is an insurance salesman.

Some years ago, Edith learned how to make clothes in an academy in her town.  She has a small sewing workshop in her home where she makes all kinds of clothing.  However, what she enjoys making the most is women's and girls' clothes.  She works filling orders from private individuals and also currently has a contract with the State for making school uniforms.  She works with one of her daughters who she pays for her work.  Edith works every day from 6.00am to 10.00pm and sometimes until even later when she has orders to fill.  She has more than 15 years experience in her work and has done very well.

Edith will use this new loan to buy fabric, thread, buttons and other sewing supplies.  Her dreams are to have a larger workshop and to complete her jobs on time because she has quite a few orders to deliver.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, buttons and other sewing supplies

loans.name: Genis

texts.en:
Genis is a 34-year-old entrepreneur from San Miguel, Bohol. Genis has had a sari-sari (convenience) store business for three years. He sells biscuits, canned goods, instant noodles and spices. He also sells dried fish to his community. Genis earns 6,000 PHP per month with his business. He works hard to save for his future family.

Genis is requesting a loan to buy more items to sell such as rice and soft drinks. Genis hopes to experience a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as rice and soft drinks.

loans.name: Aidah

texts.en:
Aidah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has two children, both of whom are in school. 

Aidah sells secondhand clothes at the market. She also sells charcoal. She sells her products on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last five years and works seven days a week. 

Aidah has requested a loan of 1,200,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bales of secondhand clothes. Her major business challenges are seasonality and transportation. Her goals and aspirations are to become a wholesaler and also to buy a plot of land on which to build rental rooms. 

Aidah lives in her own house where the family has access to electricity but not piped water.  Her monthly expenses include feeding the family, school  fees and medication.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Gogo Group

texts.fr:
Mme LUCIE est la représentante du groupe GOGO. Elle est mariée et mère d’un enfant. Il est âgé de 09ans et  va à l’école. Elle a 03 personnes à sa charge.

Mme vend des produits de beauté et des mèches depuis 03ans. Elle s’approvisionne  au grand marché  de Ouaga. Ses clients sont  les voisins et amis.

 Mme veut  s’acheter  10 boites de pommade ;10 boites de champoing ;30 paquets de mèches et 01 douzaine de crayons pour maquillage.

Elle  épargne ses bénéfices et aide à la scolarisation de son  enfant. Mme ambitionne ouvrir un grand magasin  pour son activité.
texts.en:
Mme Lucie is group leader of GOGO. She is married with one 9 year old girl who goes to school. Mme Lucie has three people in her care. 

She has sold cosmetics and hair pieces for three years. She sources her goods from the large Ouaga market. Her customer base is made up of cousins and friends. 

She would like to purchase 10 pots of hair balm, 10 crates of shampoo, 30 packs of hair pieces and a dozen makeup sticks. 

She puts aside her profits as savings which help pay for her child's education. Mme Lucie's goal is to open her own store.

loans.use: to purchase 10 jars of hair balm, 10 crates of champagne, 30 packs of hair pieces, and a dozen makeup sticks

loans.name: John

texts.en: John, 29 years old and married to Caroline, has been selling second-hand jackets for the past year. Having been introduced to KADET LTD by a staff member, John is now requesting his first loan to purchase jackets for resale in his business.

loans.use: to purchase jackets for resale in his business.

loans.name: Kossivi

texts.fr:
Kossivi est un homme âgé de 27 ans. Il est mariée å une ménagère et n’a pas d’enfant.
Kossivi travaille comme revendeur depuis 2011. Il vend des produits cosmétiques pour tous clients dans un quartier de Lomé. Il achète les produits au même lieu. Il travaille seul. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la rupture de stock.
Kossivi a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits cosmétiques. Il veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Kossivi voudrait agrandir la taille de son activité. Il dit qu’avec les profits, il prévoit de prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Kossivi is 27 years old and married to a homemaker. They have no children. 

Kossivi has been working as a reseller since 2011. Working alone, he sells beauty products to all types of customers in a district of Lomé. He buys his merchandise in the same area. At this time, his main difficulty is a depletion of stock. 

Kossivi is seeking his first loan from WAGES to buy cosmetic products. He wants to reinvest in his activity.

In the coming years, Kossivi would like to expand his business. He plans to use the profits earned to provide for his family.

loans.use: to buy beauty products for resale.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 48-year-old married woman and she has five aduls children. She lives in Taiz, Yemen. She is a very energetic and happy woman. 

She is enterprising and sells retail items for daily consumption from her home. Her principal customers are her neighbors, family members and friends. She has worked at this activity for several years and has shown an ability to grow and maintain her clientele due to the length of time she has been in business. 

Fatima is requesting a loan of 80,000 YER from AMB to invest in her business and buy more products such as soft drinks, sugar, biscuits and eggs to offer her customers.

Her main dream is to get ahead with her family and give them a better life.

loans.use: to buy more products such as soft drinks, sugar, biscuits and eggs to offer her customers.

loans.name: Sultan

texts.en:
Sultan is a 35-year-old married man and has two children who live with him in Taiz, Yemen. 

He has been operating a women's clothing sales business for two years. He started out for financial reasons. Since he didn't have an income, he decided to obtain money and help his family this way. 

He has a lot of ambition to succeed in his business, that's why he wants the loan of 100,000 YER from AMB in order to buy dresses, skirts, blouses and ladies' accessories for his business.
 
In addition of his current business, he hopes to open a men's clothing sales business.

loans.use: to buy dresses, skirts, blouses and ladies' accessories for his business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 54 years old and married to Otachi. She is the mother of one child. They all live in Nakuru, Kenya. 

Josephine practices dairy farming. From the sale of milk, she is able to cater to her family’s needs. 

She plans to use this loan to buy dairy feed for her cows. In the future, Josephine hopes to own a dairy farm and become a milk supplier.

loans.use: buy dairy feed for her cows.

loans.name: Julia
