texts.en:
Julia is a 37-year-old married woman. She has five children ranging from 6 months to 14 years old. She describes herself as honest and a go-getter. 

Julia operates a food stall where she sells French fries. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located at a residential area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as the high price of potatoes. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more potatoes for preparing French fries for selling. Julia's business goal is to run a restaurant within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her living standard.

loans.use: to buy potatoes for preparing French fries for selling.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 54 years old. He is married to Alice and together they have two children. 

Francis is a dairy farmer and has been in this business for the past seven years.

This is his first loan with KADET LTD. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.

He will use the loan amount to purchase a dairy cow.

In the future, he hopes to be the leading dairy farmer in his area.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Kaija

texts.en:
Kaija is a 45-year-old father of four children living in Kagadi, Uganda.

For three years he has been operating a retail shop where he normally sells food. His major challenges are customers not paying on time and price fluctuations. He dreams of having his children educated and buying a car.

He would like to diversify his business to include a supermarket. Kaija wants a loan to buy groundnuts, maize and beans for sale.

loans.use: to buy groundnuts, maize and beans for sale.

loans.name: Andrew Muchangi  Waihenya

texts.en:
Andrew is 37 years old and married. He has three children. 

He runs a retail shop to earn a living. He has been in the business for four years and has employed one person. 

To earn extra income, he does farming. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to improve his living standards and hopes to expand his business in the future. 

He has applied for 80,000 KES to buy sugar, maize flour and cooking oil to resell.

loans.use: To buy sugar, maize flour and cooking oil for resale.

loans.name: Mariano

texts.en:
Mariano is a 53-year-old married man with seven children between 7 and 27. 

Mariano works as a farmer in San Miguel, Bohol. He primarily grows rice crops to sell. Mariano earns 5,000 PHP per month doing this farming. Mariano works hard to provide for his family's needs. He also sells fish to his community to earn an extra income.

Mariano has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and more fish to sell. Mariano hopes to earn better and be able to sustain his children's education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and more fish to sell.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en: Naomi is 47 years old and married with three children. She does pig raising to earn a living. She has been in the business for 16 years and has employed one person. To earn extra income she does farming. She describes her business environment as good because there is limited competition. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to improve her living standards and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 100,000 Kenya Shillings to buy more pigs.

loans.use: To buy more pigs.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is 29 years old and married with one child. She sells tea and snacks to earn a living. She has been in the business for two years and describes her business environment as competitive because many people do the same business. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able improve her business and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy milk, tea leaves and sugar.

loans.use: To buy milk, tea leaves and sugar

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a 28-year-old married woman from San Miguel, Bohol. She and her husband are both farmers. Marilyn's husband mainly manages their farm. Marilyn helps cultivate their land and plant rice crops. She also rents a stall at the market to sell their harvest. Marilyn does her best to manage her time between business and her children.

Marilyn is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes to achieve an abundant harvest. She plans to use her extra profit to save for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Tima

texts.en:
Tima is a 32-year-old married woman. She has four children and all are enrolled in school. Her husband runs a fishing business. Tima operates a food stall kiosk and sells her goods at the market. She's worked in this business for 10 years. Her primary customers are residents nearby. She describes her greatest business challenge to be seasonality and her highest monthly expense is school fees.

Tima owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy wheat flour bundles, sugar and cooking fat. Tima aspires to open another kiosk in the future. She joined Yehu to access funds to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour bundles, sugar and cooking fat

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr:
Awa est une femme âgée de 29 ans. Elle est célibataire et a un enfant.
Awa travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2008. Elle vend du charbon de bois pour tous clients à domicile. Elle achète les produits dans les marchés de l’intérieur. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est de la rupture de stock.
Awa a requis son troisième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter du charbon de bois. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Awa voudrait agrandir la taille de son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de prendre soin de son enfant.
texts.en:
Awa is 29 years old. She is a single mother of one child. She has been working as a reseller since 2008. She sells charcoal to anyone from her home. 

She buys her stock at the inland markets. She works alone and at this time, her main obstacle is a depletion of stock. 

Awa is seeking a third loan from WAGES to buy charcoal. She wants to reinvest in her activity. 

In the coming years, she would like to expand her activity. She plans to use her profits to take care of her child.

loans.use: to buy charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel, 29, is a married man with an 8-year-old child. 

He works as a farmer in San Miguel, Bohol. Joel has been growing and selling rice for eight years. He earns 4,000 PHP per month doing this farming. 

Joel also started a sari-sari store business to increase his income. His wife manages the store where they sell canned goods, snacks and toiletries.

Joel has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and more items to sell at his store. Joel plans to use his extra income to pay for his child's school expenses.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and more items to sell at his store.

loans.name: Dickson Muritu Wambui

texts.en:
Dickson is a businessman. He runs a retail shop to earn a living. He has been in the business for eight years and has employed one person. 

To earn extra income he does dairy farming. 

He describes his business environment as favorable because there is limited competition. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to improve his living standards and hopes to expand his business in the future. 

He has applied for 80,000 KES to buy sugar, rice, maize flour and cooking oil for resale.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, maize flour and cooking oil for resale.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 52-year-old man from Vihiga. He is married to Jane and they have four children from 10 to 25 years old.

Peter operates a grocery stall selling various vegetables and fruits. He has been in this business for the last 25 years and makes a monthly income of KES 19,000. 

He is taking his fifth loan from KADET Ltd., which he will use to buy a stock of kale, oranges, avocados and tomatoes. His profits will be used to educate his children. His dream is to grow his stall through KADET funding.

loans.use: To buy a stock of kale, oranges, avocados and tomatoes for sale.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 45-year-old mother of four children who operates a grocery business which she has run for three years now. Customers not paying on time and price fluctuations are some of the factors affecting the development of the business. She dreams of having her children educated and of buying a car. She would like to buy land for crop growing and diversify her business into a supermarket.

Elizabeth wants a loan to buy items like sugar, salt and Blue Band margarine for her grocery for sale.

loans.use: to buy items like sugar, salt and Blue Band margarine for sale in her grocery .

loans.name: Titus

texts.fr:
Titus est un homme âgé de 35 ans. Il est célibataire et a un enfant.
Titus travaille comme responsable commercial depuis 2009. 
Titus a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin de payer les frais de dédouanement d’un véhicule de transport en commun. Il veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Titus voudrait agrandir la taille de son activité. Il dit qu’avec les profits, il prévoit d’assurer l’éducation de son enfant.
texts.en:
Titus is a 35-year-old man. He is single and has one child.

Titus has been working as a sales manager since 2009.

Titus sought his first loan through WAGES in order to pay the customs clearance fees for a public transportation vehicle. He wants to reinvest in the business.

In the coming years, Titus would like to enlarge his business. He says that with the profits, he plans to ensure the education of his child.

loans.use: to clear a vehicle through customs

loans.name: Charité Plus Group

texts.en:
Luzeta was elected as chairwoman of the Community Bank named "Charité Plus" in replacement of Batinga who was the leader last cycle and took a break this cycle to focus on other activities. The group is made up of 24 members firmly united to receive loans from the MFI (microfinance institution) HOPE DRC in order to develop their businesses.
Luzeta sells salted fish. She sells in a market located in the mid-eastern part of Kinshasa.  She has been in business since 2001. She borrowed two loans from the MFI HOPE DRC for business expansion and fully repaid them. With the next loan, Luzeta will be able to meet her customer demand by buying 2 salted fish boxes and generate additional profits. Her business makes a profit of US$30 per week. Her ambition is to diversify her business by opening a beverage facility in her area. Luzeta is 35 years old and married with five children between the ages of 1 and 6 years old. Two of them attend school.

loans.use: to expand her inventory of fish by buying 2 salted fish boxes

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is a youth client, age 25 years old and married. Ali has been an owner of a men's clothing shop since 2008. He has sufficient experience in this field and a deep understanding of local customers – he knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and is  well known in the surrounding area.

Ali is requesting a $2100 youth loan in order to redecorate his shop. He is aiming for more profit to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: To redecorate his shop.

loans.name: Yunuslar Group

texts.en:
Saniye (in the brown sweater on the left) is 35 years old and single.  She was born in İstanbul.  She always took responsibility for her whole family, quickly becoming the family matriarch. She earns her living selling clothing, pajamas, towels, etc. in the city bazaar, which she has been doing for eight years. 

Saniye had many difficulties when she first started working, but now she has succeeded in streamlining her work and has now advanced so much that she takes her siblings to the bazaar and bought a car.  When she started, she did not have a place in any bazaar or a definite customer base. She just knew she had to work. She could not imagine that the situation she finds herself in now would come. 

To build up her customer base, Saniye went door to door with a bag; she did not have capital so she would just buy three to five items to sell and contribute to the household. In time, she was able to find her own space at the city's bazaars; she sent her siblings to every one of those bazaars. At that point, she needed a vehicle because their biggest problem was carrying the goods they brought to the bazaar. She says she created things out of thin air through borrowing. 

Saniye always had problems getting inventory until she came into contact with Maya. Now she has been able to buy herself a car, achieving the most important step for her. Saniye still has expenses, such as her car payments and buying gas, but she is current with her payments.

Saniye is requesting a loan from Maya, which she will use to buy clothing, pajamas, and towels.  She buys wholesale with the loan and is able to repay it before the due date. 

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff Volunteers,

Saniye,  1976 İstanbul doğumlu.Ailesinin ortanca çocuğu olmasına rağmen bütün bir ailenin sorumluluğunu üzerine alarak biranda ailenin reisi olmuş. Kendisini ailesine o kadar adamış ki evlilik bile düşünmemiş. Hayatını semt pazarlarında her çeşit giysi,pijama,havlu vb satışı yaparak kazanıyor.bu işe başlayalı 8 sene olmuş başlangıçta çok zorluklar çekmiş fakat şimdi işini düzene koymayı başarmış ve o kadar ilerletmişki şimdi yanında kardeşlerinide pazara çıkarıyor ve hatta aracını bile almış.  Bu aşamaya gelene kadar çektiği zorlukları şu şekilde anlatıyor; bu işe başlarken herhangi bir pazarda yerim yoktu,belli bir müşteri çevrem yoktu sadece çalışmaya mecbur olduğumu biliyordum bu nedenle o kadar azimle ve istekle başladımki şu anda bulunduğum duram gelmeyi hayal bile edemezdim. Müşteri çevremi oluşturana kadar elimde çanta kapı kapı dolaştım,sermayem olmadığı için alabildiğim 3-5 parça şeyi satıyor evin geçimine katkıda bulunuyordum.  Yaşlı bir anne ve babanın desteğime ihtiyacı vardi çünkü insan azmettikten sonra başaramayacağı şey yok.  Zamanla birer birer de olsa semt pazarlarından kendime yer bulabildim ve o pazarlarların her birine kardeşlerimide gönderdim bu seferde araç sıkıntımız vardı çünkü aldığımız malları pazara götürmek en büyük sıkıntımız oluyordu bunları hep yoktan var ederek borçlanarak yapıyordum sermaye sıkıntımız mayayla tanışana kadar hep devam etti.bu süreçte kendime bir araç alabilmek benim için ön önemli aşama oldu şimdi tabiki hala sıkıntılarım oluyor arabanın masrafları ,benzin masrafları ama ben bunların üstesinden çok şükür gelebiyorum.  Sermaye benim için ekmek demek bunu insanlardan gidip bize biraz borç verirmisiniz mal alıcam diyemezsiniz ,bankalar bizim gibi sosyal güvencesi olmayan insanlara çok sağlıklı bakmıyorlar ama Maya bizim kurtarıcımız gibi,her mal alımında çektiğimiz kredilerle gidip toptan mal getiriyoruz ve vadesinden çok önce kapatabiliyorum böylece tekrar kredim için açık bir kapım olduğunu bilmek bana güven veriyor.  İyiki varsın maya teşekkürler.

loans.use: to buy clothing, pajamas, and towels.

loans.name: Felister

texts.en:
Felister is 35 years old, married, and has five children. She sells charcoal to earn a living, and has been in the business for four years. She describes her customers as low income earners because they live in slums. 

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to educate her children and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 20,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy charcoal for resale.

loans.use: To buy charcoal for resale

loans.name: Marivel

texts.en:
Marivel has had a sari-sari (general) store for three years. She sells items like bread, detergent soap, toiletries, and also dried fish. Marivel's husband works as a fisherman. Marivel works hard to support her husband in providing for their family's needs. They have a seven-month-old child. 

Marivel is requesting a loan to buy more items to sell such as bread, soft drinks and dried fish. Marivel plans to use her extra profits to start renovating their house.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as bread, soft drinks and dried fish

loans.name: Cornel Sewe Oduor

texts.en:
Cornel is 34 years old, married, and has five children. He does auto repair to earn a living. He has been in the business for four years and has employed one person. He describes his business environment as competitive because many people do the same business. He also describes his customers as low income earners because they live in slums. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to educate his children and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 100,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy spare auto parts.

loans.use: To buy spare auto parts

loans.name: Peter Muthumbi  Kamau

texts.en:
Peter is 29 years old and sells charcoal for a living.  He has been in the business for four years and has employed three people. He describes his customers as low income earners because they live in slums. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to improve his living standards and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 65,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy charcoal for resale.

loans.use: To buy charcoal for resale

loans.name: Joseph Marie

texts.fr: Joseph  est un jeune marié, sans enfant. IL a arrêté ses études il y a six ans  et se consacre à l'exploitation des terres familiales et à l'élevage. Il vit avec ses deux parents ainsi que ses frères et sœurs. Il achète des moutons qu'il revend au bout de trois mois après les avoir bien engraissé. Afin de renforcer son activité, il sollicite un pret de  50 000f pour acheter 2 moutons. Son ambition est de développer ses capacités.
texts.en:
Joseph is a young married man without any children. He lives with his parents and siblings.

Having ended his studies six years ago, he now looks after the family land and breeds sheep. He buys sheep that he fattens and resells after three months. 

He is seeking a loan of 50,000F to strengthen his activity by purchasing a pair of sheep. His goal is goal is to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy a pair of sheep for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Anna

texts.fr: Mme Anna est une femme mariée.Elle est mère de trois enfants.Depuis 2 ans, elle tient une alimentation devant son domicile oû elle vend des denrées de première nécessité aux voisins.Son commerce génére des revenus assez modestes qui lui permettent néanmoins de prendre en charge ses propres besoins et certains dépenses d'entretien de sa famille. Elle sollicite un pret de 150000f pour acheter du riz, du sucre et de l'huile afin de renforcer son fonds de commerce. Son ambition est d'agrandir son alimentation.
texts.en: Madame Anna is married and the mother of three children.  For two years she has been running a grocery store in front of her home where she sells staples to her neighbors.  Her business brings her an income, though modest, which helps her to meet her personal needs and certain family expenses.   She is requesting a loan of 150,000f  to buy rice, sugar, and oil in order to build up her business.  Her goal is to expand her grocery store.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and oil.

loans.name: Sokhna   Coumba

texts.fr: Sokhna est une femme qui exerce un commerce de poisson fumé, de poisson séché  et de légumes.Elle tient une table au marché sa localité.Elle s'approvisionne à 15 km de son village, dans une grande ville de pêche qui a vu naître le premier président du Sénégal. Elle transporte ses produits sur des charrettes qui arpentent des chantiers à travers la brousse.Ce travail très dure pour elle, lui permet néanmoins de prendre en charge ses besoins et ceux de ses enfants notamment leurs frais de scolarité, d'habillement et de santé.Afin de renforcer son fonds de commerce, elle sollicite un pret de 230 000f pour acheter une bonne quantité de poisson fumé et de poisson séché. Son ambition est de commercialiser ses produits dans les autres régions du pays.
texts.en: Sokhna is a woman who runs a business selling smoked fish, dried fish and vegetables. She has a table in the market in her town and gets her supplies 15 km away from her village, in a large fishing town where the first president of Senegal was born. She transports her produce on the carts which go up and down the construction sites through the scrubland. This work is very hard for her, but nevertheless enables her to provide for her needs and those of her children, notably their school fees, clothing and health. In order to strengthen her business, she is requesting a loan of 230,000 francs to buy a large quantity of smoked and dried fish. Her ambition is to be able to sells her products in other regions of the country.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of smoked and dried fish

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr:
Adjo est une femme  âgé(e) de 37 ans. Elle est mariée å un  revendeur.  Elle a 03 enfants, dont 02  à l’école. Les premiers ont 07 ans et le dernier a 04ans.
Adjo travaille comme infirmière et revendeuse de produits pharmaceutiques depuis 1999. Elle exerce seule son activité à la maison et achète les produits pharmaceutiques à Lomé
Adjo a requis son quatrième  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits pharmaceutiques et des lits d’hôpital. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Adjo voudrait agrandir son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit d’avoir une famille bien éduquée  et bien heureuse.
texts.en:
Adjo is a 37-year-old woman.  She is married to a reseller.  She has three children, two of whom attend school.  Her two oldest children are 7 years old and the youngest is 4.

Adjo has been working as a nurse and reselling pharmaceutical products since 1999.  She works alone from her home and buys her pharmaceutical products in Lomé.

Adjo has requested her fourth loan from WAGES in order to buy pharmaceutical products and hospital beds.  She wants to reinvest in the activity.  

In the coming years, she would like to expand her activity.  She says that with the profits, she plans to have a well-educated and happy family.

loans.use: to buy generic medicines and hospital beds

loans.name: Abdou

texts.fr:
Abdou est un jeune agriculteur qui fait du maraichage depuis 10 ans. Il vient solliciter un crédit pour la 3ème fois car il voudrait acheter des semences de choux, poivrons et des intrants agricoles (essence, fumier, engrais).
Abdou est marié et avec les bénéfices de son exploitation, il réussi à prendre en charges les besoins quotidiens de sa famille. 
Il possède des terres qui ne sont pas exploitées c’est pourquoi il aimerait dans l’avenir, bénéficier d’un fond plus important pour les mettre en valeur.
texts.en:
Abdou is a young farmer who has been practicing market gardening for 10 years. He is requesting a loan for the 3rd time as he would like to buy cabbage and pepper seeds, and agricultural inputs (petrol, fertilizer).

Abdou is married and the profits from his farm enable him to provide for the daily needs of his family. He owns uncultivated land and would like at some point to have more significant funds, so that he can exploit it.

loans.use: to buy cabbage and pepper seeds, and agricultural inputs (petrol, fumier, fertilizer).

loans.name: Mbayame

texts.fr: Madame Mbayame  est une jeune mariée de 32 ans qui habite dans une des localités du Sénégal. Elle évolue dans le secteur du commerce. Elle pratique la vente d’habits, de chaussures, de tissus teintés, de poissons grillés et de petit déjeuner. Elle a une expérience de 5 ans dans son activité de commerce.  Elle a choisi son activité dans le souci de lutter contre l’oisiveté et de subvenir à ses petits besoins personnels.  Ce qui l’intéresse  le plus ce sont les flux financiers qui découlent de son activité. Elle est membre du guichet de l’U-IMCEC de sa zone  d’habitation depuis décembre 2011. Elle sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de tissus teintes qu’elle compte revendre. Son souhait  est  d’accroitre davantage  ses revenus pour mieux prendre en charge ses besoins personnels.
texts.en: Madame Ndeye Khary is 60 years old. She has been working in trade for more than 8 years, i.e. buying and selling crockery and jewellery. She also provides services in premises located on a level of the market in the community where she has her business. She is involved in the rental of chairs. She chose to work in trade and providing services in order to combat idleness. What she enjoys most of all is the contact with the public and the financial benefits. She has been a member of one of the branches of U-IMCEC since February 2007. She has already paid back four previous loans. She is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs in order to buy dyed fabrics she intends to resell. Her hope is to grow her revenues to be better able to take care of her personal needs.

loans.use: to buy dyed fabric for resale

loans.name: Nguyen Thinep

texts.fr: Madame Nguyen  Thinep habite au Sénégal. Elle est âgée  de 36 ans. Elle est enseignante de profession et s’active en meme temps dans le commerce de parfums, encens, tissus teintés et divers autres articles. Elle a une expérience de 2 ans dans son activité de commerce. Elle a choisi cette activité dans le but  d’avoir des revenus supplémentaires, en plus de son salaire. Elle est surtout intéressée  par les bénéfices que lui génère son activité. Elle est membre du guichet de l’U-IMCEC de la localité  ou elle vit depuis juillet 2010. Elle y a déjà remboursé un crédit de 500 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de produits qu’elle commercialise. Elle souhaite redémarrer son activité de commerce pour arrondir les fins de mois. Les bénéfices que lui procure son activité lui permet de subvenir a ses besoins ponctuels (exemple achat de canapé  pour sa maison).
texts.en: Madame Nguyen Thinep lives in Senegal. She is 36 years old. She is a teacher by profession and also works as a trader of perfume, incense, dyed fabric and various other items. She has 2 years of experience in this business. She chose this activity in order to have an additional income besides her salary. She is particularly interested in the profits that her business activity generates. She has been a member of the branch of U-IMCEC situated in her community since July 2010. She has already repaid a loan of 500,000 francs that she used for the purchase of products for trade. She wants to relaunch her trading business in order to round-up her salary. The profits she gains from her activity enable her to meet her specific needs (i.e. to buy a sofa for her house).

loans.use: to buy perfume, incense and dyed fabric for resale

loans.name: Bichiko

texts.en:
Bichiko is 51 years old. He is unmarried and lives with his father in a village of the Dmanisi District. Bichiko works as teacher in a local school. His father is retired. Along with his main job Bichiko is busy with family agriculture. They have five milk cows and sell to local companies that produce dairy products. Also, Bichiko owns 40 bee-hives with bee-colonies. He takes honey from the bee-hives twice a year and sells it on the local market. The total average monthly income of the family is 1100 Laris, including the monthly pension of Bichiko's father. 

Bichiko used his first Kiva loan for expansion of his bee-keeping business. He fully repaid the loan in March. As a result of the first loan the income of the family increased, as now they have 10 more bee-hives and sell more honey. 

Bichiko requested a second Kiva loan for diversifying the family's agricultural business. He plans to start growing potatoes. With this loan Bichiko will purchase potatoes for sowing. He will sow potatoes on a family-owned plot of land and get the harvest in late spring. Selling  harvested potatoes will give additional income to the family. Bichiko and his father will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes for sowing

loans.name: Kwadzo-Bonsu

texts.fr:
Kwadzo-Bonsu est un homme âgé de 22 ans. Il est célibataire et n’a pas d’enfants.  
Kwadzo-Bonsu travaille comme revendeur de portables et accessoires de portables  depuis 2009. Il vend seul à toutes personnes et na aucune difficulté principale.
Kwadzo-Bonsu a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des portables et des accessoires de portables. Il veut réinvestir dans l’activité et faire la vente de portables sur le plan international.
texts.en:
Kwadzo-Bonsu is a 22-year old man. He is single with no children.  
Since 2009, Kwadzo-Bonsu has been selling mobile phones and accessories. He is an individual seller, he sells to different types of customers and has no major problems doing so.
Kwadzo-Bonsu has obtained his first loan from WAGES in order to buy mobile phones and accessories. He wants to re-invest in his business and sell phones internationally.

loans.use: to buy mobile phones and accessories.

loans.name: Hojalatería Group

texts.es:
El grupo Hojalatería está conformado por tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Ruth Verónica quien se dedica a la venta de sartenes y cosechas de tamarindo desde hace diez años. Este negocio lo inicio junto a su esposo quien es artesano.
Las otras integrantes son María del Carmen quien se dedica a la venta de sartenes y ropa desde hace 5 años y Eugenia quien vende cosechas de tamarindo.
texts.en:
The Hojalatería communal bank is comprised of three hard-working and enterprising women.

One of them is Ruth Verónica.  She has devoted herself to selling frying pans and harvesting tamarind for ten years.  She started this business together with her husband, a craftsman.

The other members of the group are María del Carmen who has been selling frying pans and clothes for five years, and Eugenia who sells harvested tamarind.

loans.use: to make frying pans.

loans.name: Gina Marlene

texts.es:
En la parroquia Andrés De Vera de la ciudad de  Portoviejo, conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen  cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal 4 De Agosto.

En este lugar vive la señora Gina, tiene 36  años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos de 15, 13 y 10 años de edad, los dos mayores estudian en colegio y el menor en escuela. El marido es guardia de seguridad.
 
Ella es un gran madre y esposa que  para obtener sus propios recursos y con estos ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo y  de productos de Avon, Esika y Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los  días y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta aunque sus clientes más conocidos siempre llegan hasta su casa, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada fin de semana. Tiene más de seis años  que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos, pantalones, blusas y ropa en general. Este es el tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer.
 
Su sueño es tener un local para vender ropa y todos sus productos.
texts.en:
The members of the 4 de Agosto communal bank meet every two weeks.  They meet in the Andrés De Vera parish in the city of Poroviejo, which is known as the city of the Royal Tamarinds.  

This is where Gina, age 36, lives.  She is married and has three children, ages 15, 13, and 10.  The two older children go to high school, and the younger one goes to primary school.  Her husband is a security guard.  She is a great mother and wife.  In order to get her own resources and to help her husband with the household expenses, she sells clothes by catalog.  She also sells Avon, Esika, and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and women’s accessories).

She works every day, and she sells by going door to door.  However, the customers she knows the best come to her house.  She leaves the products on credit, and she collects every week-end.  She has been doing this for over six years, and it is going very well for her.

This loan is to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, pants, blouses, and general clothing.  This is her third cycle in her communal bank.  She likes it because the payments are easy to make.

Her dream is to have a place to sell clothes and all of her products.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, pants, blouses, and general clothing.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 59 years old and married.  He operates a retail business, which he has been doing for 20 years. He started this business using capital he earned from farming.

David is requesting a loan, which he will use to buy salt, sugar, and cooking oil.  Price fluctuations and inadequate capital are factors hindering the development of his business. In the future, he dreams of buying a car and hopes to expand his business and hire employees.

loans.use: to purchase salt, sugar,  and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 40 years old, married, and has three children. Her husband works as a barangay councilor.  Marivic started her eatery business one year ago. She cooks food that she sells to her community. Marivic is able to help support her family's basic needs with her income. 

Marivic is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy ingredients such as pork, chicken, vegetables, spices, and cooking oil. Marivic hopes to be a successful business woman in the future. She also hopes to expand her business to a big restaurant.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as pork, chicken, vegetables, spices, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Jehova Nice Group

texts.es:
El grupo Jehová nice está conformado por cinco personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es la señora Ángela Dominga quien desde hace aproximadamente 30 años tiene una pulpería. Ella invertirá el crédito en la compra de varios productos.
Las otras integrantes son Rosa Antonia quien vende prendas de plata desde hace 4 años, María Magdalena elabora tortillas y pinol hace 10 años, Nora Amalia vende pollos y Esperanza tiene una pulpería desde hace 15 años.
texts.en:
The Jehová Nice communal bank is comprised of five hard-working and enterprising people.

Ángela Dominga is one of them.  She has had a grocery store for approximately 30 years.  She will use the loan to buy various products.

The other members are:

Rosa Antonio – has been selling silver jewelry for four years

María Magdalena – has been making tortillas and "pinol" (toasted corn flour and a drink made from it) for ten years

Nora Amalia – sells chicken

Esperanza – has had a grocery store for 15 years

loans.use: to buy basic grains.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 47 years old and hardworking.  She has been making seats for eight years.  She started as an alcohol dealer, then went into produce, and after acquiring enough capital she ventured into the seat-making business.

Mary is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy materials for making seats. Price fluctuations and inadequate capital are affecting her business. Her goals are to educate her children, build a permanent home, and expand her business to other markets.

loans.use: to purchase materials for making seats.

loans.name: Socorro Group

texts.es:
El grupo Socorro está conformado por cuatro personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Rosaura quien tiene una pulpería desde hace 2 años e invertirá el crédito en surtir su negocio principalmente en granos básicos.
La otras integrantes son Janeth se dedica al comercio de vajillas (platos, cubiertos, tasas, vasos…etc.), Miriam  vende hojas desde hace 7 años y Catalina vende frutas y refresco desde hace 7 años.
texts.en:
The Socorro ["Aid"] group is made up of four hard-working and enterprising women.  One of them is Rosaura who has had a convenience store for the last two years.  She will invest her loan in stocking up her business, mainly with basic grains.

The other members are Janeth, who works selling tableware (plates, flatware, cups, glasses, etc.), and Miriam, who has been selling leaves for the last seven years, and Catalina, who has been selling fruit and refreshments for the last seven years.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains.

loans.name: Sebastiana Petrona

texts.es:
La señora Sebastiana Petrona es casada, tiene 71 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 8 hijos los cuales no estudian, se dedica a la atención a una tienda de consumo diario, inicio este negocio con un préstamo adquirido, hasta el momento lleva 15 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a la panadería.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de productos, jugos, aguas gaseosas, cereales, fideos, queso, huevos y otros productos. Espera en el futuro tener mas capital y crecimiento de su negocio.
texts.en:
Señora Sebastiana Petrona is married and 71 years old.  She did not have the opportunity to attend school, and has eight children who did not attend school.  She runs a store for everyday products, a business that she started with a loan she received.  She has 15 years of experience so far, and has the help of her husband who works in a bakery.

She is requesting a loan that she will use for purchasing products such as juice, carbonated water, cereals, noodles, cheese, eggs, and other products.  In the future she hopes to have more capital and to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase products for her store.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
Miriam de 42 años de edad, habita en Yalaguina, Estelí es madre de dos hijos , casada. De oficio comerciante se dedica a la venta y elaboración de rosquillas. Actividad que realiza desde hace 23 años. Inicio a los 19 años de edad cuando solo se dedicaba a vender luego fue aprendiendo como se elaboraban y cuales era el tipo que mas solicitaban los clientes con el tiempo fue ahorrando hasta lograr poner su propio negocio. Hoy en dia tiene un pequeño taller donde trabaja con su esposo y sus hijos. Ella tiene como expectativa lograr vender sus rosquillas y exportarlas a Estados Unidos pues considera que es un producto de mucha calidad. 
Ella requiere el préstamo para comprar bolsas de empaque para sus rosquillas , pues son bolsas caras y necesita capital para poder comprar y vender sus roquillas con una buen presentación . Le gustaría ampliar su volumen de producción y asi lograr dar empleo a mujeres que viven cercanas a su comunidad.
texts.en:
Miriam is 42 years old and lives in Yalaguina, in Estelí.  She is the mother of two children and is married.  She works in retail, making and selling donuts, which she has been doing for the last 23 years.

She started at 19 years of age, when she began on her own to sell donuts.  Later, she learned how to make them, and also learned which were they type that her customers most wanted.  Over time she has been able to save money to set up her own business.  Today she has a small workshop where she works with her husband and children.  She has the expectation that she will be able to sell her donuts and export them to the United States, as she considers them to be a high-quality product.

She is requesting the loan to purchase packaging for her donuts, as her packaging is expensive and she needs capital to be able to purchase them and sell her donuts with good presentation.  She would like to increase her production volume and in this way be able to provide employment to women who live near her community.

loans.use: to purchase packaging for her donuts.

loans.name: Elias

texts.es: El socio Elias continua con su taller de mecánica el sociodesea invertir en la compra de pinturas para autos, escaleras de fierro entre otros.
texts.en: Elias continues with his auto repair shop  He wants to invest in paint for autos, metal ladders, among others.

loans.use: to buy paint for metal.

loans.name: Aida Rebeca

texts.es:
Aida Rebeca tiene 24 años de edad es soltera no tiene hijos, vive con los padres en Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar.

La VRC Emmanuel está conformada por 12 socios esta ventanilla queda a 40 minutos de la oficina ubicada en el recinto San Juan de Llullundongo perteneciente a Guaranda.

Aida se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de papas, maíz, además se dedica a la venta de leche, papas y cría ganado.

Solicita el crédito para comprar abonos, fertilizantes, abono orgánico, urea, líquidos mata plagas. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá aumentar el negocio.

Las compras y las ventas lo hace en Guaranda  cada 15 días.

El sueño es poder comprar una finca. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es el transporte y la competencia.
 En el tiempo libre le gusta ver televisión y disfrutar de la época navideña.
texts.en:
Aida Rebeca is 24 years old. She is single and doesn’t have children. She lives with her parents in Guaranda, in the province of Bolívar.

The “Emmanuel” communal bank is made up of 12 members. This service point is 40 minutes from the office, located in Recinto San Juan de Llullundongo, which is in Guaranda. 

Aida works in agriculture, planting potatoes and corn. She also sells milk and potatoes and raises cattle.

She is requesting the loan to buy manure, fertilizers, compost, urea, and liquid pesticides. With the help of this loan, she will be able to grow her business. She buys and sells in Guaranda every 15 days. 

Her dream is to buy a farm. The challenges she faces are transportation and competition. 

In her free time she likes to watch television and enjoy the Christmas season.

loans.use: to purchase manure, fertilizers, compost , urea, and pesticides

loans.name: Rosada Group

texts.es:
El grupo Rosada lo conforman cuatro personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Lucrecia quien desde hace 5 años se dedica a la venta de artesanías en el mercado de artesanías. Ella invertirá el crédito en la compra de jarrones.
Las otras integrantes son Rosa propietaria de una pulpería la cual inicio hace 2 años, Rosa Amalia quien vende huevos y Urania del Socorro quien elabora ropa típica desde hace 15 años.
texts.en:
The Rosada ["Pink"] group is made up of four hard-working and enterprising women.  One of them is Lucrecia, who has been selling handicrafts in the handicrafts market for the last five years.  She will invest her loan in purchasing vases.

The other members are Rosa, who is the proprietor of a convenience store that she started two years ago; Rosa Amalia, who sells eggs; and Urania del Socorro who has been making traditional clothing for the last fifteen years.

loans.use: to purchase vases.

loans.name: Massa

texts.en:
Massa is 33 years old, married, and has three children.  She lives in Caldwell. She has been selling chicken, red oil, and charcoal in the market for 10  years.

Massa  is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase more chicken, red oil, charcoal, etc. Her dream is to become an international businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase more chicken, red oil, charcoal, etc, for her business.

loans.name: Paula Stela

texts.es:
En la parroquia Andrés De Vera de la ciudad de  Portoviejo, conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen  cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal 4 De Agosto.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Paula, tiene 44 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 22  y 18 años de edad, ambos estudian en universidad y aun vive con ella. Su esposo es taxista.
 
Ella aprendió belleza y arreglo personal en una Academia de la localidad, es una muy buena madre y esposa que para ayudar a solventar los gastos del hogar se dedica a  realizar trabajos de pintado de uñas, cortes  de cabello, entre otras cosas de arreglo personal, realiza estos trabajos en su casa y a domicilio como lo prefieran sus clientes. Ella espera después de un tiempo poder instalar su salón de belleza ya que aun no cuenta con lo necesario y  poco a poco va comprando para algún dia poder tener su salón, lleva 12 años dedicada a esta actividad y le ha ido bien ya que con sus ganancias ha ido comprando  materiales y herramientas de trabajo.

Este crédito es para comprar esmaltes, tintes y más herramientas para realizar su trabajo. Ella lleva 5 ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos.
 
Su sueño es tener su salón de belleza con todo lo necesario para brindar un gran servicio.
texts.en:
In the Andrés De Vera parish of Portoviejo city, which has been known for many years as "the City of the Royal Tamarinds", the members of the "4 de Agosto" communal bank meet every two weeks.

This is where we meet Señora Paula.  She is 44 years old and married, and has two children aged 22 and 18 from this relationship.  Both of her children attend university and are still living with her.  Her husband is a taxi driver.

She studied beauty and personal care at an academy in the area.  She is a very good mother and wife, who works to help cover the household expenses.  She works painting nails, cutting hair and doing other personal care activities.  She does this work in her home or in her customers' home, depending on her customers' preference.  She hopes that with time she will be able to start up a beauty salon, but she still doesn't have what would be necessary to do this, and so bit by bit she will purchase what she needs so that one day she can have her salon.  She has been working in this field for 12 years, and it has gone well for her; with her earnings, she has been able to buy supplies and tools for her work.

This loan is for purchasing nail polish, hair dye, and other tools for doing her work.  She has had five lending cycles with her communal bank, and likes the communal bank because of the support it provides with the loans.

Her dream is to have her beauty salon, with everything she needs to provide great service.

loans.use: to purchase nail-polish, hair-dye and work tools.

loans.name: Guisell

texts.es:
La señora Guisell Enriqueta es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien tiene dos negocio una mueblería los cuales comercializa en ferias y panamá, además tiene  una dulcería “dulcería chepita”. Ella invertirá el crédito en la compra de madera preciosa para realizar unos muebles.
Guisell está casada con don Marcos con quien tiene dos hijos.
texts.en:
Ms. Guisell Enriqueta is a hard-working woman and entreprenuer who operates two micro-enterprises, a furniture-making business that sells its products in local public markets and in Panama, plus a sweets store called "Dulceria Chepita". 

She will invest her loan in purchasing precious wood for making furniture. Guisell is married to Marcos with whom she has two children.

loans.use: buy wood for her furniture-making business.

loans.name: Wilma Francisca Navarrete Medrano

texts.es: Wilma Francisca es una emprendedora que ha luchado por salir adelante y sacar  a su familia, ella ya ha venido trabajando con Fundación León 2000 lo cual ha demostrado ser una persona perseverante que tiene metas en la vida para salir adelante con su negocio  he ir creciendo cada día. Actualmente esta emprendedora está solicitando financiamiento para invertir en el negocio en la compra de ropa, camisas, sandalias, pantalones, entre otros productos demandados por los clientes.
texts.en:
Wilma Francisca is an enterprising woman, who has managed to move ahead in her life and bring her family along.  She has already been working with Fundación León 2000, and has demonstrated that she is a persevering woman who has goals in her life for moving forward by growing her business on a daily basis.

This entrepreneur is currently requesting financing to invest in her business by purchasing clothing: shirts, sandals, and trousers among other products which are requested by her customers.

loans.use: to purchase clothing: shirts, sandals, and trousers among other products which are requested by her customers.

loans.name: Berania

texts.es:
La señora Berania Auxiliadora es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien es estilista y tiene un pequeño y modesto salón de belleza desde hace 5 años. El crédito lo invertirá en productos de belleza principalmente cosméticos y tintes.
Ella está casada y tiene un pequeño por el cual trabaja arduamente.
texts.en:
Ms. Berania Auxiliadora is a hard-working woman and entreprenuer, a stylist who has had a small and modest beauty salon for some 5 years. This loan will be invested, principally, in beauty products such as cosmetics and hair coloring.

Berania is married and has a small child for whom she works arduously.

loans.use: buy cosmetics and hair coloring for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Farida lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has six children, all of whom are in school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members.

She sells sweet bananas at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last eight years. She works seven days a week.
 
Farida has requested a loan of 800,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy sweet bananas.  She generates additional income through selling charcoal. Her major business challenges are seasonality and thieves. Her goals and aspirations are to build rental houses and also to start going to villages for sweet bananas and charcoal. 

She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity, but does not have piped water.  Her monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of sweet bananas.

loans.name: Francisco Javier Soza

texts.es:
El señor Francisco Javier es un hombre trabajador y emprendedor quien es propietario de un taller de calzado desde hace 4 años. El invertirá el crédito en materia prima como pega, suelas, plantillas, cuerina, cuero, hilo, Brasil…etc.
Francisco trabaja junto a su esposa la cual le ayuda a vender.
texts.en:
Mr. Francisco Javier is a hard-working and enterprising man who has owned his own shoe repair shop for the last four years. He will invest this loan in primary shoe repair materials such as glue, soles, insoles, leather, thread, and other shoe components.

Francisco works together with his wife who helps him with sales.

loans.use: buy primary shoe repair materials such as glue, soles, insoles, leather, thread, and other shoe components.

loans.name: Zviad

texts.en:
Zviad is 27 years old. He lives in the village of Mamulo, East Georgia, with his wife, Mariam, and one-year-old son. The only source of income for the family is agriculture. They have two milk cows. Zviad makes cheese from the milk they receive and sells it to local dairy products retailers. 

Also, the family owns a .5 hectare plot of land, where potatoes are grown. Zviad sells harvested potatoes locally to greengrocery retailers. The total average monthly income of the family is 1,000 Laris.

Zviad requested credit for purchasing quality seed potatoes. He will work hard during the whole spring on the plot. Zviad hopes that the weather conditions will be favorable as well, and the family will get a good harvest in early summer. The family will use the received income for financing the family’s daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes for sowing.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 42-year-old married man with six children living in Kagadi, Uganda. For the past ten years, he has operated a produce business, dealing primarily in groundnuts. He started by farming, got capital after good harvests, and decided to start his current business. He likes this business because it has a short value chain. He faces a problem of price fluctuations and inadequate capital, which hinders his business growth. He would like to educate his children, build a good house, and expand his business to other markets.

loans.use: to buy groundnuts for sale

loans.name: Zaur Kochiashvili

texts.en:
Zaur is a 51-year-old farmer from the village of Ganakhleba, East Georgia. He lives with his family: wife Nargiza and 25-year-old daughter. The family earns a living through agriculture. They have 7 milk cows and 10 calves. Zaur and Nargiza produce cheese and sell it to local retailers. They also sell calves in the village. The family's average monthly income is 1,200 GEL. 

Zaur requested credit for purchasing calves. He will grow them at his farm for five months and sell them in late summer for a higher price. The family will earn additional income, which will be used for purchasing household goods and improving the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a 31-year-old gentleman with a family of four children living in Kagadi, Uganda. For two years he has been operating a local brew business and this has helped him to support the family. 

After realizing that agriculture had a long value chain, he abandoned the practice and ventured into his current business, which has proved to be very lucrative. Inadequate capital and high fuel prices are the most limiting factors to the growth of this business.

James wants a loan to buy local brew for sale. He would like to educate his children and build a good house. He says that in the future he wants to expand this business to other new markets.

loans.use: to buy local brew for sale.

loans.name: Kamo

texts.ru:
Камо занимается ремонтом автомобилей более 20 лет. Он принимает индивидуальные заказы на ремонт автомобилей и таким образом содержит семью. Камо переоборудовал свой собственный гараж в автомастерскую, где он и осуществляет свой бизнес. Необходимые запчасти Камо привозит из Еревана для чего он использует свой собственный старый небольшой грузовой автомобиль. Данный факт позволяет ему значительно сократить расходы своего бизнеса. Также у Камо есть все необходимое оборудование для бизнеса. Камо очень любит свою работу и поэтому работает без выходных. 
Камо 49 лет и он живет в Капане. Он родился в Нагорном Карабахе и переехал в Капан в юном возрасте, когда решил поступать в капанский строительный техникум. Камо женат и у него трое детей: две дочери и сын. Дочери уже замужем и проживают отдельно. Жена Камо работает в детском саду. 
Кредит на сумму 1.000.000 драм необходим Камо для покупки компрессора и необходимых автозапчастей для своего бизнеса.
texts.en:
Kamo has been involved in repairing cars for over 20 years.  He takes individual work orders to repair cars and, thus, supports his family.  Kamo remodeled his own garage into an auto repair shop, where he runs his business.  He brings in necessary spare parts from Yerevan and uses his own small, older truck for this purpose.  This allows him to reduce business expenses significantly.  Kamo also has all of the necessary equipment for the business.  He loves his work very much and works without days off for this reason.  

Kamo is 49 years old, and he lives in the city of Kapan.  He was born in Nagorno-Karabakh and moved to Kapan when he was young as he decided to apply to the Kapan construction college.  Kamo is married and has three children - two daughters and a son.  The daughters are already married and live separately.  Kamo's wife works in a kindergarten.  Kamo needs a loan in the amount of 1,000,000 dram to purchase a compressor and necessary spare auto parts for his business.

loans.use: to buy a compressor and spare auto parts for his business

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen needs the loan to buy maize, groundnuts, and beans for resale. He is a 26-year-old hardworking man with four children living in Kagadi, Uganda. Price flactuation and inflation hinder his business. His dreams are educating his children and hiring employees to help him expand his business.

loans.use: to buy maize, groundnuts, and beans for resale.

loans.name: Lidia De Los Angeles

texts.es:
La señora Lidia de los Ángeles es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien se dedica al comercio de productos variados desde ropa, cosméticos, plásticos y verduras desde hace 4 años. Ella solicita el crédito mujer el cual está destinado para uso personal principalmente el autocuido.
Ella invertirá el crédito en gastos médicos y unos exámenes.
texts.en:
Lidia de los Ángeles is a hard-working and enterprising woman who has been selling a variety of products, such as clothing, cosmetics, plastic items, and vegetables for four years. She is applying for a women's loan, which is earmarked for personal use, mainly self-care.

She will use the loan for medical expenses and some tests.

loans.use: To get a medical check-up and tests.

loans.name: Elmira

texts.ru: Эльмире 44 года.   В 1994 году, в поисках источника дохода,  Эльмира начала свой бизнес в торговле галантереей со стартовой суммой в 20,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря настойчивости  и упорному труду,  Эльмира сумела развить свой бизнес  с ежемесячным доходом  в 10,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день ассортимент товаров не представлен в изобилии, и по этой причине Эльмира  обратилась  в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 130,000 сом (KGS).  Доходы от кредита Эльмира  планирует вложить в  расширение товаров за счет обуви.
texts.en: Elmira is 44 years old. In 1994, while looking for a source of income, she started her own business selling small personal and home accessories with an initial investment of 20,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her persistence and hard work, Elmira succeeded in developing her business so that it now earns 10,000 som (KGS) per month. Currently, the variety of goods on offer is limited, which is why Elmira has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 130,000 som (KGS). She plans to invest her profits from this loan into further expanding her product range by offering footwear in her shop.

loans.use: to broaden the assortment of goods in her store

loans.name: La Gran Amistad  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal La Gran Amistad está formado por 6 socias quienes viven por la parroquia de Cumbe en Cuenca,  este lugar es de clima frió y tiene una gran belleza natural, su arquitectura es una mezcla de lo colonial y lo moderno, su gente mantienen la cultura de sus padres, se dedican al comercio, cría de animales y a la agricultura. Nuestras socias son mujeres responsables, amables y de un gran corazón, laboran diariamente en diferentes actividades las mismas que les permiten solventar los gastos de sus hogares y mantener una solvencia económica independiente.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. María, tiene 42 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 7 hijos, cuatro de sus hijos son casados y tres de ellos viven independientes, solo un hijo casado vive en su casa y comparte los gastos del hogar,  sus tres hijos siguientes tienen 16, 11 y 10 años de edad, su hijo de 16 años estudia en el colegio y sus dos últimos hijos estudian en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora en la agricultura, la casa en la que vive es arrendada.

Doña María se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y cría cuyes y gallinas, también trabaja en la agricultura labrando terrenos ajenos.

En el banco comunal se encuentran hace 6 años y su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cuyes y gallinas.

Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
The communal bank « Gran Amistad » (Great Friendship) is made up of six members who live in the parish of Cumbe in Cuenca. This place has a cold climate and great natural beauty. The architecture there is a mix of colonial and modern. The people maintain the culture of their parents and work in commerce, raising animals and agriculture.  Our members are responsible women who are friendly and have big hearts. They work daily in various business activities which allow them to cover their household expenses and maintain independent financial solvency.
One of the group members is Maria. She is 42 years old, married and in her marriage has conceived 7 children. Four of her children are married and three live on their own. Only one of their married children lives at home and shares the household expenses. Her next three children are 16, 11 and 10 years old. Her 16-year-old son is studying in high-school and her last two children are in one of the city schools. Her husband works in agriculture and they are renting the house in which they live.
Maria takes care of the household chores and raises guinea pigs and chickens. She also work in agriculture, working in other people’s fields.
She has been in the communal bank for 6 years and she will invest her loan in the purchase of guinea pigs and chickens. 
Her goal is to have her own home.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Fernando Omar

texts.es: El Sr. Fernando  tiene 48 años y es soltero, el tiene una imprenta se dedica mas que todo a la (impresión de credenciales que se encuentra en una zona muy concurrida de la ciudad de El Alto. este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, Fernando utilizara este préstamo  para la compra de material de imprenta para su negocio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es el crecimiento de su negocio, el Sr. Fernando enfrenta retos en su negocio que son ser mejor en la zona y  utilizara los beneficios para seguir creciendo, es una persona muy trabajadora se siente agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en: Fernando  is 48 years old and single.  He has a printing business and mainly prints ID cards.  His business is located in a very busy area of the city of El Alto.  This loan is his first with the institution.  He will use the loan to buy printing materials for his business.  He is requesting the loan so that he can grow his business.  Fernando faces challenges such as being the best in his area.  He will use the profits he makes to continue growing the business.  He is a very hard-working person and feels grateful to the institution for the support that they are giving him with this loan.

loans.use: to buy printing materials

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is 25 years old, married, and has two children. He lives in Kagadi, Uganda. Julius has been operating a retail shop for five years.  He started by delivering bread from door to door and after saving enough profits he rented a room where he now operates.

Julius is requesting a loan, which he will use to buy bread, juice, and sodas to sell. His challenge is price fluctuations; his dreams are educating children and hiring employees to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase bread, juice, and sodas to sell.

loans.name: Gulbara

texts.ru: Гулбаре 54 года, замужем, воспитывает внука 2-х лет.  В качестве источника дохода для семьи, Гулбара  20 лет назад начала заниматься животноводством.  Начатое с 60,000 сом (KGS)  хозяйство  на сегодня приносит около 15,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи  молочных и мясных  продуктов. Благодаря упорному труду Гулбары, ее поголовье насчитывает  4 дойной коровы и 15 овец. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гулбара обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы Гулбара планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота.
texts.en: Gulbara is 54 years old, married, and is bringing up her 2-year-old grandson. To provide for her family, 20 years ago Gulbara began raising livestock. Today, her business, which she started with an initial investment of 60,000 som (KGS), earns roughly 15,000 som (KGS) per month from sales of milk and meat products. Thanks to Gulbara's persistent work, her herd currently has 4 dairy cows and 15 sheep. In order to continue developing her business, Gulbara has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a credit of 100,000 som (KGS) to purchase additional livestock. She plans to invest her profits into further animal purchases.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Adriana Paola

texts.es: Adriana de 21 años( vive milagro ecuador). Ella comenzo este trabajo por amistades que le ayudaron con la iniciativa y de la venta. Le pareció bonito trabajar vendiendo ropa y decidió hacerlo para ella. Con mucho esfuerzo y dedicacio trabaja todos los días . a futuro ella desea tener sus cosas y crecer en su negocio. Con el préstamo comprara (pantalones blusas).
texts.en: Adriana, 21, lives in Milagro, Ecuador.  She started this work thanks to friends who helped her start selling.  She thought that working selling clothes was nice so she decided to do it for herself.  She works every day with much effort and dedication.  In the future, she'd like to have her things and grow in her business.  Whe will use the loan to buy pants and blouses.

loans.use: to buy pants and blouses.

loans.name: Francisco Manuel Bonilla Guevara

texts.es: Francisco de 63 años vive  (milagro ecuador) . el decidió seguir este negocio por que es familiar. Con mucho esfuerzo y ganas trabaja todos los días. el les enseña a sus hijos a que realicen el trabajo que es el de ser mecanico.  A futuro el desea encontrarse con todos sus hijos que algunos estanfuera del país y mejorar su negocio. Con el préstamo comprara (maquinarias, reparacion de carros).
texts.en: Francisco is 63 years old and lives in Milagro, Ecuador.  He decided to work in this business because it is a family business.  He works every day with a lot of drive and effort.  He is teaching his children to work as mechanics.  In the future, he would like to be with all of his children (some are currently abroad) and improve his business.  He will use this loan to buy machinery for repairing cars.

loans.use: to buy machinery for repairing cars

loans.name: Francisca Kana Yauri

texts.es:
Francisca es una mujer muy trabajadora, vive en la ciudad de camana, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener unas hermosas playas, clima cálido, por su agricultura, en especial el cultivo del arroz y por la generosidad de su gente. Es madre de 2 hijos cuyas edades comprenden 15 y 11 años a los cuales ama muchísimo y son su razón de vivir y trabajar cada día. Como buena peruana ama la comida típica de nuestro país,  por ello uno de sus platos favoritos es el riquísimo “Arroz Chaufa”, en sus tiempos libres le gusta mucho ver televisión en especial los noticieros.

Con mucho esfuerzo Francisca logro iniciar su negocio de venta de periódicos, laminas, revistas, entre otros; todos los días se levanta muy temprano para poder abrir su puesto de periódicos, ella trabaja alrededor de 12 horas diarias y puede atender hasta 20 clientes en el día, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es atenta con los clientes.

Francisca está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada, ella podrá comprar más mercadería para su negocio (revistas y pago adelantado de periódicos), lo que le permitirá tener mercadería novedosa para sus clientes y mejorar sus ingresos; asi seguirá trabajando para cumplir su gran sueño:
“Darle una buena educación a sus hijos y comprar una carreta de periódicos”
texts.en:
Francisca is a very hard-working woman who lives in the city of Camana, a city that is known for its beautiful beaches, warm climate, agriculture (specifically rice farming), and generosity of its people.

She is the mother of two children ages 15 and 11.  She loves them dearly, and they are the reason she lives and works each day.  Like a good Peruvian, she loves the traditional food of our country, and one of her favorite dishes is the rich “Arroz Chaufa” (Chinese Peruvian rice).  In her free time, she really enjoys watching television, especially the news.

With a lot of effort, Francisca was able to start her business selling newspapers, laminated educational materials, magazines, and other items.  Every day she gets up very early to open her newspaper stall.  She works about 12 hours per day and can serve up to 20 customers in a day.  She thinks she does well with her business because she is attentive to her customers.

Francisca is very grateful  for the loans from Kiva.  Thanks to the assistance provided, she can buy more merchandise for her business (magazines and newspapers on a payment plan), which will allow her to have new merchandise for her customers and improve her income, and she will continue working toward her big dream:  “To provide a good education to her children and buy a cart for newspapers”.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (newspapers and magazines).

loans.name: Wuilson Narciso Muyos Arreaga

texts.es: Wilson de 49 años  vive en  (paraíso Guayaquil ). El empeso  ese negocio de ser carpintero con su padre siendo oficial ahora el se desempeña en ser maestro de carpintería . también cuando el lo cree necesario es taxista. Con muchas ganas y dedicacio trabaja todos los días. a futuro el desea tener un buen negocio y tener en buena salud a su familia. Con el préstamo comprara ( mercadería) madera, herramientas de pincateria.
texts.en: Wilson, 49, lives in Paraíso, Guayaquil.  He started the carpentry business with his father who was an official.  Now he works as a master carpenter ad when he deems it necessary also works as a taxi driver.  He works hard every day with much dedication.  In future he'd like to have a good business and have his family in good health.  He will use the loan to buy wood and snack shop equipment.

loans.use: To buy wood.

loans.name: Laura Beatriz Erazo Pico

texts.es: Laura de 26 años vive (milagro ecuador) ellos son de origen Tungurahua – ella decidió viajar con su esposo a milagro donde residen ahora. Comensaron vendiendo ropa dianvulando como les fue bien decidieron ponerse un basar. Con mucho esfuerzo y dedicacio trabaja todos los días con la ayuda de su esposo e hijos .a futuro ella desea ver a su hija mayor graduada de la universidad y mejorar su negocio. Con el préstamo comprara ( mercadería perfumes papelería).
texts.en: Laura, 26, lives in Milagro, Ecuador.  They are originally from Tungurahua.  She decided to move to Milagro with her husband where they now reside.  They started out selling clothes from place to place and since they did well they decided to open a store.  With much effort and dedication she works hard every day with help from her husband and children.  In the future she'd like to see her eldest daughter graduate from university and to improve her business.  She will use the loan to buy merchandise, perfume and stationery items.

loans.use: to buy stationery items, perfume and notebooks.

loans.name: Guillermo Nicanor Mosquera Piñancela

texts.es: Guillermo de 46 años( vive isla Guayaquil) el inicio au negocio aprendiendo de su padre qu tenia un negocio similar de venta de pescado. Cuando el lo cree necesario trabaja taxiando. El trabaja con muchas ganas y esfuerzo solo . a futuro el desea tener mayor capital y engrandar su negocio . con el préstamo comprara herrmientas para su vehiculo y reparacion de vehiculo tambien pescados para mejores ventas.
texts.en: Guillermo, 46, lives in Isla, Guayaquil.  He started his business learning from his father who had a similar business selling fish.  When he deems it necessary he works as a taxi driver.  He works very hard and with much effort by himself.  In the future he'd like to have more capital and to enlarge his business.  He will use the loan to buy tools for his vehicle and to repair his vehicle and also to buy fish to improve sales.

loans.use: herrmientas para su vehiculo y reparacion de vehiculo tambien pescados  to buy tools for his vehicle, to repair the vehicle and also to buy fish.

loans.name: Angela Del Rocio

texts.es: Soria de 35 años vive (suburbio Guayaquil). el decidió ponerse un negocio de papelería debido a que se quedo sin empleo por que tenia que cuidar a sus hijos. Con ganas decidió ponese una papelería. Trabaja todos los días con muchas ganas . a futuro ella desea darle una mejor vida a sus hijas junto con el esposo. Con el préstamo comprara (utiles escolares para vender en su papeleria).
texts.en: Soria is 35 years old and lives in Suburbio de Guayaquil.  She decided to set up a stationery business because she found herself without a job as she had to care for her children.  Soria works with a lot of enthusiasm every day.  In the future, she would like to help her husband to provide their children with a better life.  She will use her loan to buy school supplies to sell in her stationery store.

loans.use: to buy school supplies

loans.name: Yolanda Janeth

texts.es: Yolanda de 42 años vive (milagro ecuador). Ella empeso su negocio en su casa el de vender almuerzo con el tiempo fue progresando y decidió poner su negocio en un local en donde ahora tiene su restaurante. Con esfuerzo y ganas trabaja todos los días. A futuro ella desea ponerse su negocio en el centro de milagro y que se haga conocido. Con el préstamo comprara (mesa sillas refrigeradora).
texts.en: Yolanda is 42 years old and lives in Milagro, Ecuador.  She started her business at home, selling lunches.  Over time, she made progress and decided to set up her business in separate premises which is where she now has her restaurant.  She works with effort and enthusiasm every day.  In the future, she would like to establish her business in the center of Milagro and become well known.  She will use her loan to buy a refrigerator, tables and chairs.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator, tables and chairs

loans.name: María Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora María del Socorro es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien desde hace 7 años tiene un tramo de ropa en el mercado. Ella el crédito que solicita es el crédito mujer el cual está destinado para el uso personal de las clientas para su autocuido.
Ella con el crédito realizara unas mejoras en su hogar.
texts.en: María del Socorro is a hard-working and enterprising woman who for seven years has had a clothing section in the marketplace.  The credit requested is credit for women, which is for the personal use of clients.  She will use the credit to make improvements to her home.

loans.use: to make improvements on the roof of her house.

loans.name: Ponciano

texts.es: El señor Ponciano tiene 45 años de edad, es de una familia humilde de escasos recursos económicos, por lo tanto cultiva superficies muy pequeñas, vive en el  municipio de Mizque del  departamento de Cochabamba. Trabaja en la agricultura desde hace 20 años, produce cebolla, papa, frejol y leche de las vacas, ya que también cuenta con ganado lechero de muy buena raza, una parte de la producción es para la alimentación de su familia y lo que queda comercializa en el mismo lugar donde vive a los comerciantes de la misma población de Mizque. Don Ponciano es una persona muy respetado en su comunidad, por la dedicación a su trabajo y por ser el responsable de la educación de sus hijos. Don Ponciano, está solicitando el presente crédito para comprar más semillas, abonos y agroquímicos, para mejorar la calidad y aumentar su producción y de esta forma tener más ingresos y mejorar las condiciones de vida de toda su familia.
texts.en:
Ponciano, 45, is from a humble family with scarce economic resources so he farms very small parcels.  He lives in the town of Mizque in Cochabamba Department.  He’s been working in agriculture for 20 years.  He grows onions, potatoes and broad beans and also milk from cows since he also has dairy cows of a good breed.  Part of his production is used to feed his family and what’s left over is sold in the same place where he lives to merchants from the town of Mizque.

Ponciano is a highly respected person in his community because of his dedication to work and because he’s responsible for his children’s education.  Ponciano is asking for the present loan to buy more seeds, manure and agrochemicals to improve quality and increase production thus earning more income and improving the living conditions for his entire family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure and agrochemicals.

loans.name: Giovanni

texts.es: Giovanni, tiene la edad de 34 años, es casado, y tiene 3 hijos de 8 y 4 años y un bebé de 7 meses que son su mayor prioridad. El  quiere  comprar insumos y abono para maíz y frijoles. Tiene varios años que se dedica a su finca y quiere crecer mas pensando en sus hijos. Es el primer  préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. . También, ha realizado otros préstamos en una cooperativa pero  FUDECOSUR le brindó el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de interés es mucho más baja. El  también tiene el deseo de brindarle a sus hijos  una mejor educación para que  en el futuro sean  personas  preparadas y puedan enfrentar de manera más fácil la vida.
texts.en: Giovanni is 34 years old, married, and has three children who are 8 years old, 4 years old and 7 months old.  His children are his main priority.  Giovanni would like to buy supplies and fertilizer for growing corn and beans.  He has been working on his farm for some years and, with his children in mind, he would like to grow it further.  This is the first loan that Giovanni has received from FUDECOSUR.  He has taken previous loans from a cooperative but FUDECOSUR have offered him this loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.  He would like to provide his children with a better education so that they are prepared in the future and can face life more easily.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and supplies for growing corn and beans

loans.name: Maria De Lourdes

texts.es: Maria de 31 años vive ( guasmo Guayaquil). Maria desde que se quedo sin empleo decidió ponerse un negocio de vender pollos y tener otrso ingreso vendiendo ropa y cosmeticos por catalogo "esika". Con esfuerzo y dedicación de querer salir adelante logro ponerse el negocio de pollos ya que es un poco complicado criarlos. trabaja todos los días sola. A futuro ella desea tener un negocio grande y tener una familia. Con el préstamo comprara (perfumes para la venta a sus clientes y pollos pequeños para criarlos).
texts.en: Maria is 31 years old and lives in Guasmo, Guayaquil.  When she found herself without work, she decided to set up a business selling chickens.  In order to make additional income, she also sells clothing and Esika cosmetics through a catalog.  She works with effort and commitment in order to get ahead in life.  She managed to set up a chicken business even though the animals are a little difficult to raise.  She works alone every day.  In the future, she would like to have a big business and a family.  She will use her loan to buy perfumes to sell her customers and also young chicks to raise.

loans.use: to buy chickens and perfume

loans.name: Trabajando Por El Futuro Group

texts.es: Teresa es integrante de la Alcancía Comunal “Trabajando Por El Futuro” grupo responsable que está conformado por 09 socios dedicadas a distintas actividades comerciales. Teresa tiene 60 años de edad es casada y tiene 07 hijos, actualmente sigue apoyando a 02 de ellos. Ella cuenta con una tienda la cual ofrece productos de primera necesidad, lleva más de 05 años trabajando de esta manera, este negocio le ha permitido apoyar a sus hijos con su educación y mejorar su vivienda. Teresa es buena para los negocio eso lo demuestras sus ventas, pues a pesar de la competencia ha logrado fidelizar a sus clientes. Con el crédito que solicito invirtió en su negocio comprando productos para su tienda como azúcar, arroz y leche. Teresa junto a la Alcancía Comunal "Trabajando Por El Futuro" están agradecidos con el crédito brindado ya que hacen posible su progreso.
texts.en:
Teresa is a member of the Alcancía Comunal "Trabajando Por El Futuro" ("Working for the Future") group, which is made up of 9 members who make their living through different commercial activities.  Teresa is 60 years old, is married and has 7 children.  She is currently supporting two of them.
